123001.name: Desktop Defender
123001.description:
User Summary

Desktop Defender is a classic tower defense game. Each stage you set up your defenses to eliminate the attacking creeps.

123002.name: Ganso JaJaMaru-kun
123002.description:
Ganso JaJaMaru-kun (元祖じゃじゃ丸くん ganso jajamaru-kun) is a remake of the video game Ninja JaJaMaru-kun released for the Wonderswan. It is an enhanced version of the original Famicom game with better control, but features black and white graphics. It can only be played as with a single player.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ganso JaJaMaru-kun", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123003.name: War Commander
123003.description:
Source: The Game Website.


30 years after the collapse of civilization, chaos reigns. There is no government, there is no order, there is only war. Train your troops. Research weapons. Show no mercy! WAR COMMANDER - The world is up for grabs.

123005.name: Namco Super Wars
123005.description:
Namco Super Wars is a crossover game, featuring characters from several classic Namco titles.

The game is played on a square grid, on which both the player's and computer's units are placed. Each side takes turns moving and making actions with their units. Every character has a variety of attacks and special moves that can be selected when performing an action. Some of these consume Spirit Points, which slowly regenerate each turn. The game is divided into stages. Between each stage, the player is able to visit a shop and prepare his units before starting the next stage. Unlike most RPGs, characters do not gain levels for directly defeating opponents. Instead, completion of a map will reward the players with a number of level ups, which they can then distribute among their units as they wish.

As a crossover game, Namco Super Wars includes characters from a number of previous Namco games. The games represented are the following.
Valkyrie no Bōken: Toki no Kagi Densetsu / Valkyrie no Densetsu
Dragon Buster / Dragon Valor
Dragon Spirit
The Tower of Druaga
Genpei Tōma Den
Mappy
Dig Dug
Phelios
Wonder Momo
Bravoman
Family Stadium

Source: Wikipedia, "Namco Super Wars", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

also see:
http://www.swan.channel.or.jp/swan/partner_title/title/namco...

123007.name: Tekken Card Challenge
123007.description:
Tekken Card Challenge uses the characters from Tekken 3, plus an exclusive character to the game, Crow.

Tekken Card Challenge utilizes a system similar to its Pokémon counterpart. Two opponents are to fight at a time, with various cards for different maneuvers and a 100 point HP total for damage accumulation. The player begins with a hand of four cards, drawing more as the duel proceeds. The battle system is similar to Yu-Gi-Oh! in that the three types of cards perform in a rock, paper, and scissors pattern. Attack cards are played against each other to compare values with the loser being discarded and deducting HP, an attack card played against a defense nullifies each other (except in the case of a counter), and two block cards cancel each other out. There is also a minor system of air juggling, which can be quite damaging given the correct order of cards.

Tekken Card Challenge also provides the player with a variety of game modes. There is a link mode present, 1-player battle, and (the main mode) Adventure, which allows the player to unlock more characters and duel opponents. In adventure mode, the player is given movement of a character sprite in a full environment taken place on a 15 x 15 square grid to traverse. The point of each stage is to defeat each "duelist" given limited number of steps and gain entrance to the exit.

Character list:
Heihachi Mishima
King
Nina Williams
Hwoarang
Eddy Gordo
Ling Xiaoyu
Paul Phoenix (unlockable)
Lei Wulong (unlockable)
Yoshimitsu (unlockable)
Anna Williams (unlockable)
Kuma (unlockable)
Jin Kazama (unlockable)
Forrest Law (unlockable)
Bryan Fury (unlockable)
Gun Jack (unlockable)
Julia Chang (unlockable)
Crow (unlockable)
Panda (unlockable)
Mokujin (unlockable)
Ogre or Toshin in Japan (non-playable)

Source: Wikipedia, "Tekken Card Challenge", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123008.name: Digimon Tamers: Battle Spirit
123008.description:
Digimon Battle Spirit is a fighting game originally published by Bandai and developed by Dimps for the Japanese-only WonderSwan Color handheld system under the name Digimon Tamers: Battle Spirit. It was later ported to Nintendo's Game Boy Advance for international releases in North America and Europe two years later.

The game features characters and Digimon that were included in the first three seasons of the animated series of the same name in a somewhat simplistic fighting scenario, and also has slightly arranged samples of the show's soundtrack.

The Digital World, a computer-generated subspace that exists between all forms of digital devices, and home of the creatures known as "Digimon" is under attack by a malevolent and powerful force known as Millenniummon, who seeks to corrupt all the data present in the world and modify it to his own designs. In response, several Digimon and their human companions have set out to stop Millenniummon and his minions before any irreparable harm can be done. This is accomplished in a very round-about and a-typical way to the fighting videogame genre, by finding and defeating as many opponents as possible on the way.

While structured very similarly to a conventional fighting game, Digimon Battle Spirit is much more like a barebones representation of the genre, mostly due to the limitations of the handhelds it was released on. Each character only has a handful of special attacks they can perform, with the two action buttons, A and B, allowing them to jump or attack respectively.

Each match is won by collecting small blue spheres called "D-Spirits". These are obtained by hitting your opponent, which causes a few of them to fly from their body and scatter across the battlefield. Different attacks can produce more spheres to fly out, and the player who has collected the most by the time the round ends wins. Each character can also digivolve into their most powerful or "Ultimate" (Mega) form by touching a flying Digimon named Calumon that appears every so often in each stage. This form grants them different, more powerful attacks for a limited time.

As the player advances through each stage, they will occasionally have to battle a character named Impmon. Winning or losing this encounter has no bearing on the actual game progression itself, and only serves to award more points. In the final stage, the Digimon must face off against Millenniummon himself.

Source: Wikipedia, "Digimon Tamers: Battle Spirit", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123009.name: Digimon Tamers: Battle Spirit Ver. 1.5
123009.description:
Digimon Tamers: Battle Spirit Ver. 1.5 was released exclusively in Japan for the WonderSwan Color handheld console. It expands on Digimon Tamers: Battle Spirit (released in the United States and Europe as Digimon Battle Spirit) and contains many new features and characters. Unlike its predecessor or sequel, Digimon Battle Spirit 2, this game did not receive a Game Boy Advance port.

Digimon Tamers: Battle Spirit Ver. 1.5 had a similar opening to the original game, although lengthened to contain the expanded roster (although BlackAgumon and Extra Agumon were not revealed. A shadowed Beelzemon Blast Mode is shown along with Impmon and Milleniummon

The final scene of the opening is randomly picked. The following duels could be seen at the end:
BlackWarGreymon vs. WarGreymon
MegaGargomon vs. Cherubimon
Gallantmon vs. Omnimon
Seraphimon vs. Ophanimon
Gallantmon Crimson Mode vs. Beelzemon Blast Mode

By beating the game on Normal difficulty or higher without losing, the player got a chance to battle ZeedMillenniummon as a second "final boss".

All of the original characters, including the unlockable Digimon, from Digimon Tamers: Battle Spirit were included as playable characters from the start, with the exception of Impmon. In addition, Patamon and Gatomon were added, with Seraphimon and Ophanimon as their evolutions, respectively.

In addition, there were two unlockable Digimon; An Extra Guilmon (who is unlocked by obtaining the "ultimate*" level tag in single player mode) who, like the Extra Agumon that could evolve into Omnimon, evolved into Gallantmon Crimson Mode, and the returning Impmon (who is unlocked by obtaining the "champion*" level tag in single player mode), with Beelzemon Blast Mode as a new evolution .

Three new levels were added in Digimon Tamers: Battle Spirit Ver. 1.5.:

A train level, possibly a Locomon, was included as Patamon's level. The Train had two vents on either side of the level which worked similar to the trampoline in Terriermon's level. During the match, the train passes through a modern, unnamed town. DemiDevimon are constantly flying above the fighters.

A waterfall level was included as Gatomon's level. The Digimon fight beside and behind the waterfall, with bushes here and there on the sides. Makuramon can occasionally be seen in the bushes, and Gotsumon occasionally roll down the mountain. This is the only vertical level in the Digimon: Battle Spirit series.

Instead of randomly interrupting a fight, Impmon received his own stage, which appears to be loosely based on the net from the Second Digimon Movie. Television screens of Impmon line both sides of the level, and the entire stage has an odd feel to it. Interestingly, the level is vertically symmetrical; you can see a floor above you when you're on the highest platform. The suction effect, which draws loose data to Impmon, is automatically on. There are no random enemies in this stage.

Source: Wikipedia, "Digimon Tamers: Battle Spirit Ver. 1.5", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123010.name: Guilty Gear Petit
123010.description:
Guilty Gear Petit (ギルティギア プチ Giruti Gia Puchi) is the first handheld version of the Guilty Gear series released. It is followed by the sequel Guilty Gear Petit 2. Much like Super Gem Fighter Mini Mix, it depicts the Guilty Gear characters in a super deformed style. It is also notable for the inclusion of the character Fanny, who appears only in the two Guilty Gear Petit games. The game has seven playable characters, six of which are from other Guilty Gear series games. The game was only released in Japan.

Source: Wikipedia, "Guilty Gear Petit", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123011.name: Guilty Gear Petit 2
123011.description:
The sequel Guilty Gear Petit 2 (ギルティギア プチ２ Giruti Gia Puchi Tsū) was released just eight months after the first.

The game has 13 regular characters and 6 secret characters (Testament, Venom), and four "Golden" characters (GGMillia, GGKy, GGSol, and GGMay).

The game was only released in Japan for the WonderSwan Color.

Source: Wikipedia, "Guilty Gear Petit 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123012.name: Hanjuku Hero: Aa, Sekaiyo Hanjukunare...!
123012.description:
Hanjuku Hero: Aa, Sekaiyo Hanjukunare...! (半熟英雄 ああ、世界よ半熟なれ…!! "Let the world become soft-boiled!"?) is the second game in the series. The Egg Monsters featured in the game are parodies of Final Fantasy IV characters.

The game was re-released on the WonderSwan Color in 2002. This version features a graphical overhaul and twelve new summons.

A soundtrack album for the game, titled Divertimento Hanjuku Hero, was released by NTT Publishing on January 21, 1993. It features four orchestral renderings of songs from the soundtrack, and 42 tracks from the original soundtrack. It has a duration of 51:53.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hanjuku Hero", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123013.name: Hanjuku Hero Tai 3D
123013.description:
Hanjuku Hero Tai 3D (半熟英雄 対 3D, "Soft-Boiled Hero vs. 3D") is the first title in the series to be in 3D.

A limited edition of the game was released alongside the standard edition, and included merchandise such as playing cards, an egg monster sheet, and a sketchbook. The game sold 151,000 copies the week of its release.

A soundtrack album for the game, titled Hanjuku Hero VS 3D OST, was released by DigiCube on June 25, 2003. It features two discs of tracks from this game, totaling 58 tracks and 1:50:27, and a bonus disc of tracks from the original Hunjuku Hero game, 17:57 long and with 17 tracks. Additionally, a single for the game's theme song was released by DigiCube on April 23, 2003, with the theme song "Fight! Hanjuku Hero", the song "Without Yolk...", and instrumental versions of the two, totaling 16:02 in duration.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hanjuku Hero", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123014.name: Kai Xin Guo
123014.description:
After dealing out all cards to each player equally, Players will play one card each round, starting with the first player, and rotating to the right. Cards are played by alternating face-up and face-down: the first card each round is played face down, the next card is played face up, and the third card is played face down, and so on, until each player has played one card. Starting again with the first player, everyone will take one card of their choice, choosing either a face-up card, or pressing their luck by choosing a face-down card.

The cards represent different fruits, with varying number values. Players are trying to get the highest values into their stack. There are also three special cards:
Super-fruit: this card will double the value of a single fruit card,
Caterpillar: the hungry caterpillar will reduce the value of one or more cards by half,
Pistachio: the delicious nut will lure a caterpillar away, canceling out one caterpillar card.

After all cards are exhausted, scoring begins. Highest score wins.

123015.name: Egg Monster Hero
123015.description:
Egg Monster Hero (エッグモンスターHERO) is a role playing game spinoff of the Hanjuku Hero. Egg Monster Hero was released on the Nintendo DS in Japan on March 24, 2005, and was the first game Square Enix published for that console. The game plays using the stylus for the most part. The stylus is used to drag Egg Monsters towards the enemy.

It was the 141st best-selling game of 2005 in Japan, selling 92,096 copies. A mobile phone version of the game became available in Japan on June 6, 2005. The game was apparently intended for a North American release.

The player takes the role of the series' main character, the young Lord of the Almamoon Kingdom. While the Lord has the power to summon powerful monsters out of a magical egg, he is usually found slacking off, since the world is at peace and there's nothing to do. Because the young Lord's stupidity is continuing to accelerate, Sebastian, his minister and educator, takes him to an island to train him back into shape. But unbeknownst to the Lord and his tutor, trouble is heading their way.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hanjuku Hero", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123016.name: Hanjuku Hero 4: 7-Jin no Hanjuku Hero
123016.description:
Hanjuku Hero 4: 7-Jin no Hanjuku Hero (半熟英雄4 ～7人の半熟英雄～, "Hanjuku Hero 4: The 7 Hanjuku Heroes") was released in a normal edition as well as a limited edition titled Hanjuku Ginga Bentō (半熟銀河弁当, Hanjuku Galaxy Lunch) which contained a lunch box and promotional items.

The game contains two types of battles: 100 on 100 battle using a mix of 2D and 3D, and three-on-three party-based Egg Monster vs. Egg Monster battles.

Composers Nobuo Uematsu and Kenji Ito did the soundtrack of the game. Uematsu has a cameo appearance within the game along with Tsuyoshi Sekito and Kenichiro Fukui, both of whom are members of his band The Black Mages as "Nobuo Uematsu and the Hanjuku Mages." The limited edition of the game came with a two-disc soundtrack album for the game, titled Hanjuku Hero 4 -The 7 Heroes- ~Sound Collection~. The album contains 43 tracks and covers a duration of 1:51:42.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hanjuku Hero", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123026.name: SandTrap
123026.description:
Your goal is to get as much sand as you can out of the box and into the pail. You can rotate the box by clicking and dragging with the mouse or by using the left and right arrow keys.

Navigate the sand through the box and out the opening so that it will drop into the red pail. If too much sand misses the pail, click "Reset" to try again

Once the pail is overflowing with sand, you can progress to the next level. You may also want to replay the level and try to beat your best time.

Source: The Game Website.

123027.name: DragonQuest Newsletter (Vol 2 No 11 - Dec 1995)
123027.description:
From the Table of Contents

Special Catalog Issue

In this issue:
The Catalog (One long article of everyday items for DragonQuest)

123028.name: Thwack!!
123028.description:
User Summary

Thwack!! is a single-player HTML5 game produced by Gopherwood Studios. In Thwack!!, players bunch a puck and try to get it to stop moving on a GOAL within the game. This game appears to be a spinoff of the sport Curling.

123029.name: DragonQuest Newsletter (Vol 3 No 1 - Jan 1996)
123029.description:
From the Table of Contents

In this issue:
Administrivia
Editorial
Letters
Advertisements

123030.name: Arm Chair Quarterback: A Game of Skill
123030.description:
This game was manufactured by Novelty Manufacturing Co. out of Richmond, CA in 1955. Arm chair quarterback is a game that consists of a game board, first down/yardage marker, 11 red defensive pawns, 1 tan offensive pawn, and a huddleboard with two metal stands.

The object of the gameplay: The huddleboard is placed in the middle of the board allowing the offensive and defensive teams to call their play. The offense has 9 spots/plays to place their pawn. The defense has 11 pawns with 16 spots to try and stop the play of the offense. When the huddleboard is removed each team can see the result of the play. At each spot on the board a result of the play is posted as whether its a gain, loss, turnover, TD, or incomplete. After each play, you record the information on the yardage/down marker. Like football, the offensive player must make 10 yards in 4 downs to continue or the the board is turned around to switch positions. The game can be played for 30 or 60 minutes depending on your preference. Note: All plays are based on national averages. There is no advantage to either team. It all depends on how good you are at playing QUARTERBACK!

123031.name: Seven Serpents
123031.description:
From the back cover :
A Sourcebook of Dragons

Dragons are wily and wise creatures of vast intelligence and capriciousness . . . and their dens reflect this. Herein lie seven dragon lairs and the serpents that inhabit them, following in the footsteps of the Seven Strongholds, Seven Cities, and Sacred Ground sourcebooks. Seven Serpents includes:

- The Blue Rat: A blue wyrmling has taken up residence in the palatial home of a djinni. The creature has become a nuisance by leaving droppings all over the place and attacking servants. Despite his best efforts, the djinni has been unable to catch it, so he needs some exterminators . . .
- The Dragon Moot: Every few centuries, representatives from each of the dragon breeds gather at a fallen tree nearly four miles in length. Here their leaders put aside their conflicts and discuss larger matters at hand. The current sheriff is a young half-gold/half-green dragon named Kusig who has no idea how to keep the peace.
- Cliffside: A juvenile copper dragon's lair is built into the side of a cliff, and is protected with traps and puzzles to ensure that those who seek him out deserve his help. Visitors who are unable to fly must rely on ropes and other climbing gear.
- The Last Dragon Rider: The silver dragons of Talisantha Hall once served as warrior-mounts for the knights who dwelt there. Now the last of their number wanders its desolate halls, searching for the cure to the vampirism that infects him and his lady-love.
- Tithe Bend: Frail and undersized from birth, the black dragon Dunstitz realised that the hoard he craved would require the very essence of dragon cunning and guile to attain. So, posing as a river spirit, he collects the tithe that sailors throw over the sides of their ships.
- Smoke on the Water: In a mining camp dedicated to extracting a rare ore called bog silver, the blazing hot body of a comatose red dragon generates the steam used to power drills, boring devices, water pumps, and smelters. The adamantine spike shoved through the gargantuan dragon's head is to key to its imprisonment.
- The Darkness of Space: A great gold wyrm has built her lair in the darkness of space. She survives through a combination of spells and magic items, and is served by an army of constructs. The lair houses a powerful artifact that keeps a terrible evil at bay, and the dragon does not take kindly to intruders.

123032.name: F1 World Grand Prix
123032.description:
F-1 World Grand Prix is a Formula One racing game/sim first released in 1998 for the Nintendo 64 game console and to later platforms including Dreamcast, Game Boy Color, PC and PlayStation. It is based on the 1997 Formula One season, featuring each of the 17 circuits from the season and all 22 drivers (as well as several unlockable bonus racers), with the exceptions of Jacques Villeneuve (licensing reason) and the MasterCard Lola (not recognised) team.

Gameplay

The game consists of five gameplay modes: Grand Prix, a course-by-course simulation of the 1997 season; Exhibition, a single race; Time Trial, a race against the clock and Challenge, which comprised real scenarios from the 1997 season-examples include trying to win the 1997 Hungarian Grand Prix as Damon Hill or beating Jean Alesi as David Coulthard in the 1997 Italian Grand Prix. The final mode allowed 2 players to compete in a single, split-screen race.

F-1 World Grand Prix offered a fairly realistic experience for its time. Prior to races, allowed for the fine-tuning of the player's car; including tyre tread, amount of fuel and wing angle. The cars themselves followed realistic simulated physics and were at risk of damage and wear like their real-life counterparts. Weather (and its effects) was also simulated. Visually, the game offered the same trademark appearance of live F1 coverage, and aimed to have a photo-realistic appeal.

F-1 World Grand Prix was highly acclaimed by most critics, more so than its sequel F-1 World Grand Prix II, which many felt lacked a sufficient number of improvements over the original.

Due to copyright issues, WilliamsF1 driver Jacques Villeneuve is not featured in the game and in his place is a silhouette of his body and his name is simply Driver Williams. This character's name could be customized by the player, either to personalise their driver or to unlock certain extras, such as the Silver and Gold racers.

Source: Wikipedia, "F-1 World Grand Prix", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123033.description:
Expansion for Popular Front: Escalation expands the base game by adding 54 cards and a new power for each faction, encouraging players to develop unique strategies for each of the six factions. It also introduces new retreat and naval combat rules that increase the strategic depth of the combat system. The stakes of each turn's political resolution have also been increased, as the next turn's turn order is based on this resolution.

Expansion Rules
123033.name: Popular Front: Escalation

123034.name: Bible Charades
123034.description: A Charades game that has a stack of religious quotes to act out. Play as individuals or teams. A player reference card advises about the usual Charades-type signals for book, play, etc. but it also gives a lot of signals especially thought up by the designers to be useful in a biblical connection.

123035.name: Fight On! (Issue 11 - Winter 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Bust-up at the Moon and Parrot
Level Limits & Monstrous Protagonists in Nordmark
The Darkness Beneath - Palace of Eternal Illusion
123035.description:
From the publisher's website:

Watch out! Fight On! is back with another full issue, packed to the rafters with 3 big dungeons, classes, races, rules options, monsters, spells, magic items, tables, how-to articles for new kinds of adventure, comics, two self-contained minigames, and a superabundant sideboard of succulent supplements to get your party started down the road to adventure! Dedicated to Greg Stafford and his legendary campaign of Glorantha, this issue features art and articles by Mark Allen, Kelvin Green, Baz Blatt, Jason Vasché, Gabor Lux, James A. Smith, Jeff Rients, Erin Bisson, David Coalman, Jason Sholtis, Jennifer Weigel, Erol Otus, Steve Marsh, Geoffrey O. Dale, Lee Barber, John Hitchens, Scott LeMien, Fat Cotton, Ndege Diamond, Peter Schmidt Jensen, Kesher, Patrick Farley, Ed Heil, John Larrey, Tim Snider, Carlos Torreblanca, and many, many more! Don't be caught out without your broadsword and blaster ready - Fight On!

123036.name: Fall of the Titans
123036.description:
"Fall of the Titans" is a 2-player asymmetrical card game, based on the video game "Shadow of the Colossus." In "Fall," one player takes on the role of Ronin, a human assigned with the task of defeating the great Titan...which is played by the other player.

Each player has a different process and actions that they perform. Essentially, the Titan player sets up a defense, the Ronin player determines a course of action against those defenses, results are determined, and the player then moves. But careful consideration must be taken into account with regards to planning, bluffing, and resources available in hand.

The game uses a standard deck of cards, a pawn, and some coins or some other markers, in addition to the Titan board.

123037.name: Alien Space
123037.description:
The best space shooter in the AppStore has arrived! The mission: Pilot your ship into the heart of enemy space and destroy anything that gets in your way.

The game features:

fast-paced gameplay
upgradeable ship systems and weapons
30 levels and survival mode
OpenFeint achievements and leaderboards
precise controls
awesome 3D graphics




Unlike other shooters where the best the enemy AI can do is to run into you, Alien Space offers a wide variety of enemies wielding the same weapons available to you, and then some. Blasters, lasers, tractor beams, missiles, photon torpedos… they'll throw everything they can at you. Are you up to the task?

Now available for all iPhone, iPod Touch, and iPad devices running iOS 3.0 or higher.

Source: The Game Website.

123038.name: Alien Space Retro
123038.description:
Alien Space Retro features the best of the original game, with all new retro-inspired graphics, as well as new game modes and weapons avilable through in-app purchases.

Source: The Game Website.

123039.name: Charadium II
123039.description:
Charadium is a fast & furious draw-and-guess multiplayer game that guarantees you’ll be drawn in. Your goal is to draw a given word, and other players have to guess that word.

Sounds simple, but it's unbelievable how amazingly fun and addictive this process is!

Source: The Game Website.

123040.name: Sky Defenders
123040.description:
User Summary

You are a member of a superhero team, tasked with defending your beloved city against a horde of invading robots! Tilt your iOS device to control your superhero and direct his/her powers against the ravening hordes. As combat continues, you can power up your hero, gain additional items, and advance your character.

123041.name: Cavorite
123041.description:
Cavorite is an original and genre-crossing adventure game, appealing to fans of puzzlers and platformers alike.

Dr. Cavor is trapped inside the moon! Held captive by the mysterious Selenites, Dr. Cavor endeavors to escape to the surface and from there to Earth! But first he must match wits with the dwellers of the lunar underworld, whose catacombs are complex and deadly! Dr. Cavor has but two tools at his disposal: his unique genius and his prize invention, the anti-gravity spray 'Cavorite'.

Source: The Game Website.

123042.name: Cavorite 2
123042.description:
Cavorite 2 continues the original and genre-crossing adventure game series, appealing to fans of puzzlers and platformers alike.

Dr. Cavor is back! Lacking sufficient fuel to launch his space vessel home, Dr. Cavor musters the courage to once again descend into the vast subsurface lunar labyrinth! There he must gather powerful moon gems, which harbor enough energy to propel him home. Once more armed with only his anti-gravity spray gun, Dr. Cavor puts his genius to its greatest test yet.

He must descend even deeper. He must face greater dangers. He must fight stranger foes. He must unlock the power of the gem!

Source: The Game Website.

123043.name: What Am I?
123043.description:
Bible quiz game. A card is read out and players or teams try to identify the subject. All things will be something associated with the Bible. There are 4 clues to a card, each getting easier. So, if no-one is correct after one clue, then the second clue to the same answer is tried. Then a third and a fourth, if needed. With only 50 or so cards and only one question per card, I guess replayability is not so hot.

If a player gets it right, he is given the cards and the player or team with the most cards at the end, wins.

123044.name: Jiggle-Joggle
123044.description:
Edwardian game that rewards good jiggling and joggling!

The rules (as written inside the box lid):

THE FROG RACE
“JIGGLE JOGGLE”
BY ROYAL LETTERS PATENT
— —
DIRECTIONS
Any number of players may engage in this game, the more the better.
Place all frogs in a row, the object being to jerk the frogs along the whole length of the cords, the first frog that passes the winning line is the victor.
TO START
Tie one end of the cord to a chair or table, the cord being about nine inches from the ground.
The players then go to the other end of the cords, then by pulling and slackening the cords alternately, the frogs will leap forward.
The frogs must start from where the cords are held. When they pass the winning line, indicated on the floor, the frogs may by reversed and raced back to tbe start if players desire.
BRITISH MANUFACTURE. Made in England

The Frogs are made of card and the cord is around 8 feet long.

On the box it is enthusiastically recommended by two magazines at the time. And there is also a cute verse about the fun that will be had with the game.

123045.description: Welcome to the world of Uncharted: The Board Game! In this game, you take on the role of a treasure hunter and compete with other players to gain the most Victory Points. The variety of cards that you collect represent skills and items necessary for or sought after by treasure hunters. You can increase your chances of winning by adding useful cards to your play area. Venture into dangerous ruins, search them thoroughly, and defeat waves of enemies to become a legendary treasure hunter!
123045.name: Uncharted: The Board Game
boardgameexpansion: Uncharted: The Board Game – Nathan Drake & Victor Sullivan

123049.name: The Curious Case of the Disappeared Decktet card
123049.description:
HELP! One of the cards from the original decktet has been stolen. You are on the case, like the good detective you are. The rich reward and eternal glory certainly are good motivations. Unfortunately you are not the only detective who's after the card. This makes the investigation difficult at least.
The answers you get from your fellow detectives are ambiguous and enigmatic. So... it's up to you to find the missing card first.

This is the first Decktet deduction game. All 2-9 cards but one have been dealt out. The cards in this game all show at least 4 characteristics: one rank, two suits and one type (location, personality or event). On your turn choose two characteristics you would like to know more about. Ask the other players how many times these characteristics appear on their cards. As a detective, you will find it's just a matter of elimination. It's all quite logical...

123050.name: DragonQuest Newsletter (Vol 3 No 5 - May 1996)

123051.name: Traveller Dice Set
123051.description:
From a 1984 Gamescience product catalog:

5/8th-inch, six-sided black dice with a distinctive red numeral on white starburst design, approved for and designed especially for use with TRAVELLER™ by GDW.

Letters

123055.name: Pirates of Gold Cove
123055.description:
Pirates of Gold Cove is a trick-taking card game for the whole family. New players will find the game easy to play with waves of fun for everyone. Weathered card players will enjoy the strategy of play, as vast as the deep blue sea.

The player that is dealt the ship starts the game, and each other player matches the color if they can, trying to take the trick with the highest numbered card of that color. There are cards that you want to capture for more points like treasure maps, chests, and gold coins. There is even one card that you want to avoid capturing, the dreaded Magistrate Burns. Once all the cards have been played and all tricks taken, the player that captured the Duchess Carmen receives the cards that were removed from the game, and perhaps even more points. Players total their points and are paid in gold and silver coins. Once all the coins are given out, the player with the most treasure is the winner.

The game includes high-quality plastic coated playing cards and a sack full of gold and silver coins. Whimsical characters illustrated by Monte Moore in bright colors make the game as attractive as it is fun.

123056.name: San Guo Sha: Tomb of Cao Cao
123056.description:
Scattered artifacts of the Legends of the Three Kingdoms lay hidden in Cao Cao's tomb. Find and reassemble the artifact fragments to unlock the power stored within for a millennium!
What secret is hidden in the tomb? Who can master the hidden power in the artifacts?

After Cao Cao's tomb was discovered, the explorers delve into the tomb to unlock Cao Cao's secret . The players will look for artifacts in the tomb through exploration of the debris, excavation or exchange with other explorers. The artifacts wield special power, and will aid in further exploration of the tomb. The first player to complete five artifacts wins the game.

Though this takes place in the San Guo Sha game setting, this is a stand-alone game of drawing tiles. Treasure and junk tiles will be placed face down in the middle of the table. Players will draw two tiles, and keep one. Then players will trade one of their own face-down tiles with the face-down tile of another player. The object is to be the first to collect the right tiles that will assemble the lost treasures.

The game comes with:
60 artifact tiles
4 character tiles
1 drawstring bag

123058.name: Hareposten 18 (Feb 2002)
123058.description: Editor of this issue: HC Molbech

123059.name: ARC STYLE: Soccer!! 3D
123059.description:
You don't have to worry about the finer points of offside or what counts as a foul in this easy soccer game. Enjoy fast-paced matches with the simple controls of 'ARC STYLE: SOCCER 3DS'!
There is room for endless customization with the ability to change your teams' names and uniforms, and create every team member's features from scratch to make your own original team. You can even use your own photographed face on your team members!
You can also use Nintendo 3DS Local Play with this game and enjoy multiplayer matches.

Source: The Game Website.

123060.name: Hareposten 20 (Aug 2002)
123060.description: Editor of this issue: HC Molbech

123061.name: ARC STYLE: Jazzy Billiards 3D Professional
123061.description:
You can enjoy all six types of rules such as "Jazzy Game" of the original rule, and authentic billiards game "Nine-Ball" "Eight Ball" "Rotation" "Four Balls A" "Four Balls B". There are two types of game modes "Solo Mode" thoroughly enjoyed by one person to set the degree of difficulty with a variety of "Stage Mode" to play against eight rivals. "Solo Mode" is compatible with Internet ranking, you Kisoe player and score across the country

Translated from Japanese

Source: The Game Website.

123062.name: Hareposten 21 (Dec 2002)
123062.description: Editor of this issue: Mikkel Bækgaard

123063.name: ARC Style: Simple Majhong 3D
123063.description:
Mahjong is a game you can play a simple and easy to support stereoscopic viewing.

Character can be selected as the opponent is eight.
Make a game out with a player who was in the individuality of each.

Can be found in the "KOs" performance of the game played,
You can check the playing style of their own.

Translated from Japanese

Source: The Game Website.

123064.name: ARC Style: Solitaire
123064.description:
In: "ARC STYLE Solitaire", and "Klondike" one of the most famous card game for one play, you can enjoy "Monte Carlo" that she is loved by young and old with simple rules.

The game can be played either at the bottom screen in the upper screen, making it comfortable to be able to enjoy the back and tips solitaire one hand, due to interruption save feature.

Moreover, because more and more go cards and background design can be used to clear the game going, you can also enjoy a collection of design. There are some things to be available in exchange for coin games.

Translated from Japanese

Source: The Game Website.

123065.name: Hareposten 22 (May 2003)
123065.description: Editor of this issue: Mikkel Bækgaard

123066.description: Editor of this issue: Mikkel Bækgaard

123069.name: Hareposten 25 (Aug 2004)
123069.description: Editor of this issue: Mikkel Bækgaard

123070.name: Hareposten 26 (Dec 2004)
123070.description: Editor of this issue: Mikkel Bækgaard

rpgitemversion: "Megaversal Insider Emerald Hardcover Collector's Edition" version
123071.name: Lemuria
rpgissuearticle: Lemuria: Notable Creatures of the Sea
123071.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rifts Lemuria is packed with new magic, weapons, living power armor, monstrous war steeds, weapons, and gear suitable for landlubbers and aquatic adventurers alike.

The Lemurians are an amphibious people with floating cities and magic-based technology that allows for land and underwater adventures alike. Discover the secrets and people of this lost and forgotten civilization of magic and wonder. Add amphibious capabilities to your Rifts campaigns and discover new menaces under the sea. Amphibious in nature, Lemurians wage war against the demonic on dry land and under the waves. Their exotic riding animals, weapons, armor and magic are suitable for use on land and underwater.

The Lemurians, their race, history and society.
5 aquatic races: Lemurians, Junk Crabs, Ichthyleans, Merans and Milu.
5 Sea Dragons.
5 Symbiotic Stone Vehicles (and a drone scout).
8 expansive, new O.C.C.s including the Serpent Hunter, Spouter, Oceanic Guardsman, Biomancer Gene-Mage, Birdman and others.
9 monstrous and wondrous Lemurian War Steeds.
10 suits of living Bio-Armor, plus the Wave Strider and Bio-Skins.
10 Biomancy plants and creatures from the Lemurian Gardens.
16 strange and exotic animals.
19 types of Lemurian weapons.
21 new Hydro-Psionic abilities for the Spouter and Hydros Sea Dragon.
50+ new Biomancy spells and a handful of new Ocean Magic spells.
Biomancer Gardens, herbs and magic.
The Stone Guardians of Easter Island and other mysteries.
Symbiotic creatures and Biomancy constructs; some that enable air-breathers to survive underwater indefinitely.
New dangers, new challenges, adventure ideas and more.

123072.name: DragonQuest Newsletter (Vol 3 No 10 - Oct/Nov 1996)
rpgissuearticle: The Care and Feeding of Demons
123072.description:
From the Table of Contents

In this issue:
Editorial
Letters
The Care and Feeding of Demons
Weapon Descriptions
Column: DQ ARCHIVE -- Update: The Water Works
Advertisements

123073.name: DragonQuest Newsletter (Vol 3 No 11 - Dec 1996)
123073.description:
From the Table of Contents

In this issue:
Editorial
Letters
Water Works Update
Adventure Sequence Rules
Column: DQ ARCHIVE -- Archive Update
Advertisements

123074.name: Spycraft Boot Camp I
123074.description:
User Summary:

The Spycraft design team has a program for testing potential new designers they call the Spycraft Boot Camp. Participants are asked to write and develop material for Spycraft with little preparation. This book is composed of some of the design team's favorite results from the program. Although is an official release, it is composed of unofficial adventures, equipment, and rules that were created by designers applying to become part of the Spycraft design team.

123075.name: Apocalypse: Desire Next
123075.description:
Apocalypse: Desire Next (アポカリプス～ディザイアネクスト～) is a strategy game for the Xbox 360 video game console which was developed and published by Idea Factory. It was released on November 29, 2007 in Japan. It is unknown if it will ever be published in North America or anywhere else.

Source: Wikipedia, "Apocalypse: Desire Next", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

also see Japanese website:
http://www.ideaf.co.jp/apocaly/apo.html

123076.description:
"The Last of Us is a genre-defining experience that blends survival and action elements to tell a character driven tale about a modern plague decimating mankind. Nature encroaches upon civilization, forcing remaining survivors to kill for food, weapons and whatever they can find. Joel, a ruthless survivor, and Ellie, a brave young teenage girl who is wise beyond her years, must work together to survive their journey across what remains of the United States."

Source: The Developer Website.
