123178.name: Mobile Suit Gundam: Journey to Jaburo
123178.description:
Journey to Jaburo takes place during the One Year War, and depicts the crew of the White Base making their way from the Side 7 sector of space colonies to the Federation headquarters at Jaburo. The game starts at Amuro Ray's home of Side 7, where three Zaku mobile suits attack the Federation's prototype mobile suit weapons. Amuro, in the confusion, fights the Zaku units in the Gundam, and is assigned to the White Base as the Gundam's pilot. After the White Base leaves the colony, it is pursued by Char Aznable, "The Red Comet".
Char attacks the White Base during re-entry (where the power of the Gundam's beam rifle was revealed), which diverts them into the Zeon-controlled territory of North America. After going through many Zeon defenses (including Garma Zabi in Seattle), the White Base heads into Asia, where they battle Ramba Ral, an ace pilot who raised Sayla Mass when she was a child. After Ramba Ral commits suicide by jumping into Gundam's hand with a grenade, the White Base crew makes their way to Belfast for repairs.
After they leave Belfast, they eventually make it to Jaburo, where Char's "Mad Angler" squadron finds the location of the base, and launches a massive attack to conquer it. The Zeon forces are beaten back, and the White Base, now dubbed the "13th Autonomous Mobile Squadron", heads out into space.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mobile Suit Gundam: Journey to Jaburo)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123179.name: Pathways (Issue 14 - Apr 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Faces of the Tarnished Souk: Xoti, the Usurper
Of Knives and Plagues: More Archetypes for The Secrets of Tactical Archetypes II
Slumbering Tsar: The Hidden Citadel, Part 5 - The Mind of Chaos
The Genius Guide to Feats of Multiclassing
Twenty Questions with Steven D. Russell
123179.description:
From the publisher's website:

You'll find articles by Will Mcardell and Benjamin Rombeaut (The Secrets of Tactical Archetypes II), Crieighton Broadhurst (Raging Swan Press), Steven D. Russell (101 Not So Simple Templates), Thomas LeBlanc, David Paul (Pathways Editorial). Also you will find the top products with reviews by Endzeitgeist, and an interview with publisher and game designer Steven D. Russell.

123180.name: Savage Insider (Issue 4 - Apr 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Crypt of the Crystal Lich - Mind Games
One Sandal and the Son of Odin
Savage Worlds – Worlds Shaken While You Wait
123180.description:
From the publisher's website:

Savage Insider Issue 4: Shaking Things Up is an issue all about keeping your tabletop role-playing games interesting. Game Masters have the difficult job of keeping their games interesting for the players to prevent boredom, so Savage Insider presents content and tips to help you along the way.

Shaking Things Up is a cross-genre issue with content that covers an array of genres or can be used universally. Much of this content can be utilized in a variety of ways providing maximum value to the GM who has the difficult job of keeping their player’s excited.

123182.name: Game Geek (Issue 28 - Apr 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Behind the Game, Call of Cthulu

Musing of the Avalon Stogie
Behind the Game, Call of Cthulhu

What's New
Free Stuff

123183.name: Planetary Defence
123183.description:
Defend your homeworld from alien invaders in this arcade shooter. Shoot the powerups left behind by destroyed enemies to gain legvels and upgrade your defences.

Source: The Developer Website.

123184.name: Delve: The Dice Game
123184.description:
User Summary

An iPhone version of the popular Print and Play game Delve: The Dice Game first premiered here on BGG.

Choose a party of four adventurers from a possible selection of eight:
Barbarian or Paladin
Rogue or Ranger
Wizard or Sorcerer
Cleric or Druid

From the game instructions:

"Each campaign has a different set of enemies for you to face. For each battle you will have six dice to roll. Tap the ones you would like to keep, and then re-roll the rest. You get one last re-roll after that before you are stuck with the dice you get.

Each Characters name will the light up if they have somehting they can do with your dice. Tap a power to attack the enemy and keep going until you face the Boss!"

The five campaigns are: Fey Forest, Ice Caves, Thieves Den, Dwarven Depths, Arcane Tower.

The game has GameCenter capabilities and comes with 14 unlockable achievements.

123185.description:
1941: THE WORLD IS AT WAR!

Quick and Convenient: Axis & Allies 1941 is designed to be set up and played more quickly than any previous A&A game. In essence, this is a simplified A&A experience that will introduce players to the A&A mechanics and play style. Play time runs between 1.5 to 2 hours.

Familiar Mechanics: This game utilizes the A&A game mechanics present in A&A 1942 2nd Edition, as designed by Larry Harris (the creator of the original game).

New Units: A key feature for enfranchised players is an entirely new set of unit sculpts. There are 16 all-new designs such as the P-40 Warhawk, Tiger Tank, AVRO Lancaster, FW-190, IS-2 tank, HMS Hood, He-111, and the Akagi Aircraft Carrier. These playing pieces can be used in any other A&A game, and will be desirable to players who seek to expand their A&A collections.

Game Overview

Five major powers struggle for supremacy. Germany and Japan are aligned against the great alliance of the United Kingdom, the Soviet Union, and the United States.

Designed for 2–5 players, the game is set in 1941: The Axis has great momentum and is expanding its conquests in both Europe and Asia.

Controlling one of the Axis or Allied powers, you will command both your country’s military forces and its war-time economy. Show that you are a brilliant military strategist by planning your attacks, marshaling your forces into embattled territories, and resolving the conflicts.Victory goes to the side that conquers its opponents on the field of battle and liberates or occupies the greatest cities of the world. Change the course of history in a few short hours!
123185.name: Axis & Allies 1941

123186.name: HIRAKATA
123186.description:
Hirakata is a card game made with kana, japanese syllabary. To win a game you must be the fastest recognizing hiragana and katakana.

In a small city this game was really popular. But one day a misterious power captured the card, and covered the city with a curse. Now the cards are flying all around and nobody is able to catch them, no?

Hira and Kata are the main characters of our history. They had the collection of cards and now its time to get them all again. They need your help. Will you be able to recover all cards and remove the curse?

Source: The Game Website.

123187.name: Kansen
123187.description:
Kansen is similar to Hirakata, but this time the game is based on the Kanji characters. Kanji are chinese characters that are used in Japanese. There are around 2000 basic ones and each character have a concept meaning.

The game is divided into different levels. Each one has a time limit. During the game a kanji reading will be asked and the player must find it. In each level we will ifnd items to help us and enemies to make our adventure more difficult.

Source: The Game Website.

123188.name: ZASCA!
123188.description:
Translated from Spanish

This game is a tribute to the program Buenafuente (BFN). Berto controlled by the set of the program and zasquea people from the public and tito Andreu to become the best zasqueador the world.

Source: The Developer Website.

123189.name: Fool's Brain Investigation
123189.description:
This is a brain training game with 9 different tests made by aliens to examinate how intelligent (or fool) can be the humans. There are also rankigs where player can see how intelligent (or fool) he is in the world.

Source: The Developer Website.

123190.name: Bombardment
123190.description:
Bombard the aliens in this funny Box2D game!

This is a box2d game where you have to destroy the alien invasion. Have fun bombarding them!

Some features:
- 30 levels
- Level editor
- 24 achievements
- 5 types of bombs

Source: The Developer Website.

123191.name: Dummy Never Fails: Community
123191.description:
Due to the success of the original Dummy Never Fails, and the lot of levels we received (more than 50000) we decided to launch DNF: Community.

This new title includes:
- More than 100 levels created by players and selected by us. We could only include the best.
- 50 new challenges.
- 50 new skins to unlock.

As the original, you have to launch dummies to reach the goal in a physic based game.

Source: The Developer Website.

123192.name: Dummy Never Fails 2
123192.description:
DNF 2: The sequel to the successful Dummy Never Fails, with new features, bigger levels and more skins.

Dummy Never Fails and DNF: Community have over 35 million plays on the internet. We can say that was a success so a sequel was needed.

Dummy Never Fails includes new features like gravity control. You can play throught all new 60 bigger levels, create your own or play online those created by the community. The level editor has been improved and now you can create bigger levels and rotate, resize & duplicate objects.

Being the skins one of the key points in the series we have renamed it to just "dummies". So there are 50 new dummies to unlock. There is a dummy editor included to allow players to create their own, play with them and share with the community.

Source: The Developer Website.

123193.name: Mike Shadow: I paid for it!
123193.description:
Fight against THE vending machine that fooled Mike Shadow. Revenge using weapons, magic, cheerleaders and the most devastating powers you've ever seen!


WARNING*** Very adictive!! You will spend a million hours playing!




The most epic combat ever. Fight for what is yours and unleash your wrath!

When THAT vending machine fooled Mike Shadow it was the begining of the Apocalypse! Hit the vending machine to be the strongest machine destroyer in the world! Collect money, upgrade your skills, use weapons, magic, cheerleaders and much more.

Features:
- Hit the machine and get money to buy new skills
- Over 120 upgrades!
- Upgrade your base stats "Patience", "Stress", "Critical Chance" and "Money Chance" with 10 levels for each.
- Normal attacks include weapons, magic, natural disasters and much more!
- Bonuses to increase your strength and other stats!
- Special attacks with **too much** devastating power!
- Complete scores & stats system
- 15 achievements
- Highscores
- Over 12000 frames of traditional animation (are we talking about a RECORD for a flash game?) to look smooth and funny.

Source: The Developer Website.

123201.name: Minden Playing Card Cricket Extra Teams
123201.description:
Expansion for Minden Playing Card Cricket. This includes a lot more teams and their stats. Teams represented (and the dates they were first issued:
India - 1989
England II - 1989
New Zealand - 1989
Pakistan - 1989
Post-War England - 1990
Sri Lanka - 1990
South Africa - 1990
Post-War Australia - 1990
Post-War Rest of the World - 1990
Post-War England II - 1991

123202.name: Minden Soccer
123202.description:
System for replaying individual football matches by minute-to-minute decisions. Statistics for all the 1990 World Cup teams are included, as it is a system for translating statistics from any match, so you can replay that great day for your team (unless your team is England, so there is no great day you can recreate!).

Each team is rated for ability in certain skills like 'shooting at goal' or 'passing the ball', 'movement' and so on. Once you decide the option you would like to take, you roll the dice and check on the ability. Sometimes you will retain possession and thus make the next decision, and so on, until you lose the ball and your opponent has the same choices for his team.

The one who scores the most goals, wins.

123203.name: Zero Zone
123203.description:
ZeroZone is a graphical adventure game in which the player assumes the position of the main character Stan, who must unravel the truth about his father's death. You, Stan Gonzo, find yourself delivered a will from your father, whom you have never before met. You assume his role as leader of the largest cyber technology company, the Kanary, and try to unravel how he died, who he was, and what to do next. The game starts when Stan is already sitting in his office in the Kanary where a police officer asks if you have any information to further his investigation into your father's murder. Your own investigation starts by looking around the Kanary, and meeting the rest of your family.

You move around the ZeroZone world in through a semi-3D interface, that lets you look 360 degrees around you, with panorama like scenery. You move around by clicking a section of the panorama image, where you find yourself in another semi-3D panorama scene, the game advances in the same style. Game obstacles are mainly solving puzzles, find clues and talking / interacting with other people. Some 1st person shooting action comes around every now and then, but this is more to further the plot than true fighting. The ZeroZone virtual world is quite large, with many places to visit. Also you can communicate with almost all people you find, often they reveal clues or give you hints on what to do next.

Source: Wikipedia, "ZeroZone," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123204.name: Monster Hunter Frontier
123204.description:
The first spin-off in the series to appear on the Xbox 360, it differs from the other chapters of the series by being a full-fledged Multi-player Online Game which can only be played online.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monster_Hunter_Frontier,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123205.name: Polska anno domini 2020
123205.description:
From the publisher's website:

Zawartość książki:

Książka zawiera kilkadziesiąt rysunków. Całość tekstu to około 700.000 znaków. Zawiera 9 rozdziałów :

Opowiadanie "Rysiek"
Tło Polski 2020
Jak grać w Polsce 2020
Opis Warszawy 2020
Opis Krakowa 2020
Opis Trójmiasta 2020
Scenariusz w 2020
Zbrojownia Polska 2020
Nowa karta postaci




and translation:

The book has dozens of pictures. The text in total has 700,000 characters. There are 9 chapters:

Short Story "Rysiek"
Background of Poland 2020
How to play in Poland in 2020
Warsaw in 2020
Cracow in 2020
Tri-city in 2020
Adventure scenario in 2020
Polish armory, 2020
New Character Sheet




User's summary:

As a result of polish publisher's actions, the book was printed in very limited number and each one was for a specific person - there was printed dedication on the first page.

publication year is unknown, it may have been produced in the late 90's

123206.name: Playful Malice
123206.description:
From the box: "Playful Malice is a conversational frolic for adult adults - a game in which players compare views of one another's quirks. The purpose of the game is to have fun - and, incidentally, to see who wins the most chips."

On a round, one person is called the "Target". The Target takes one of the 64 cards from the deck and reads it aloud. He reads the statements one at a time, giving players time to rate each item on their score pads from 0 to 5. The Target also rates his own personality.

Now the Target will guesses aloud how each player rated him, and depending if he is near or far from the ratings he will receive chips. The player with the most chips is the winner.

123207.name: Buffy: Action Quizz
boardgamefamily: TV Series: 	Buffy the Vampire Slayer
123207.description:
Buffy Trivia Game is the test of your knowledge of Buffy the Vampire Slayer!

In their continuing struggle against the forces of evil, Buffy and her friends must defeat a selection of vampires and demons particularly formidable. Boxes 'quiz' brighten the path to test the knowledge of the players on the main characters and key events in the series. Each correct answer and defeated demon can accumulate points throughout the game. Issues affect all the episodes of the first 5 seasons.

The winner of the game is the first player or team to reach the finish and successfully face the last vampire.

123208.name: Cédric Sacrée journée
123208.description:
Cedric like to be photographed with Chen, his girlfriend. But Chen agreed only if he pass a perfect day to be a good boy. He must collect points to charm the girl and then run to the place where she waits to be photographed with him.

There is a journey through the day of Cedric on the gameboard. Beginning with the square "Start of the day" and ending with the square "end of the day" where players is able to pose with Chen.

In his turn player rolls the color die and move his game-piece
to next square with rolled color. Then he may pass a test to roll a number dice and get a result greater or equal than the number on the box. If the test is successful he adds the points he has just won the score noted on their file and writes it on the notes (with erasable marker).

Each player has 3 event cards he may use in his turn to help provide bonuses to its dice rolls.

The first player who reaches the finish square and pose with Chen is the winner.

123209.name: Only War Core Rulebook
123209.description:
From publisher's website:

“The men and women of the Imperial Guard sacrifice more and gain less than perhaps any other arm of the Imperial Armed Forces."
–Commissar Ibram Gaunt

'Only War is a standalone Warhammer 40,000 roleplaying game experience in which players take on the roles of soldiers in the Imperial Guard, the galaxy-spanning armies of the God-Emperor. Fully compatible with FFG’s other Warhammer 40,000 Roleplay titles, this comprehensive game system explores a previously unseen side of life in the Imperium of Man.

Join the ranks of brave men and women inducted into the God-Emperor’s armies, trained to fight and sent off to far flung stars and systems to hold the line against the coming night. Despite overwhelming opposition, or perhaps because of it, these fearless soldiers are bound to each other by a code of brotherhood and honour. They are the thin line that protects the Imperium from complete and utter destruction. They are the Imperial Guard.

123210.name: The European Championship Dice Game
123210.description:
A free print and play dice game based off Shaun Derrick's excellent World Cup Game.

Moving the footballing battlefield from the World Cup to the UEFA European Championships, 2-4 players can print off tournament sheets for Euro '96 in England, Euro 2000 in Belgium/Netherlands and Euro 2004 in Portugal.

Set up is simple. Print off one A4 tournament sheet and the rules sheet. Grab six dice (preferably one red, one blue, one green, one yellow and two others). Find a pencil. You're ready to go.

The teams in the tournament will be divided out between the players who will then choose the dice they want to roll and designate the dice roll results to the teams, scoring goals, defending, scoring penalties and competing to get their teams through to the quarter finals, semi finals and ultimately the final to compete for the Championship trophy!

The European Championship Dice Game is designed to be highly portable with a short play time. Perfect to take on trips or to whip out during lunch breaks.

123211.name: Jack Bananas
123211.description:
Object of the game is to get your name in history by winning the amazing race of Isla Bananas. The winner will receive the prestigious Cup of Bananas.

The race takes place across six islands.
To reach each island, players fly at a certain speed and it will be determined by the sum of the dice that players secretly launched away from their dice cups.
If the speed is less then demanded player can't reach another island. If the speed is more the player risk to crash with his flying machine.

123212.name: Widelands
123212.description:
Widelands is an open source (GPLed) real-time strategy game. It is built upon the SDL and other open source libraries and is (and will always be) under heavy development. If you knew Settlers I & II™ (© Bluebyte), then you already have a rough idea what Widelands is all about because Widelands is heavily inspired by those two games.

User summary

Although first build of Widelands was released in late 2002, it has always been a work in progress: Ten years later, Build 17 would see its release. This game provides players with a relaxed-pace, but real-time strategy experience. The focus on the game is in strategic placement of your roads and buildings, in order to maximize access to resources, space for farms, and efficiency of your transportation infrastructure. As you expand your borders, you will encounter your enemies, and soon thereafter, blood will be shed.

Source: The Game Website.

123213.name: Konobi
123213.description:
Introduction

Konobi is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It's played on the intersections (points) of a square board, which is initially empty. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white.


Definitions

Two like-colored stones are strongly connected if they are orthogonally adjacent to each other, and weakly connected if they are diagonally adjacent to each other without sharing any strongly connected neighbor. Note that two stones of different colors are never considered to be connected.

A chain is a set of connected stones.


Play

Starting with Black, the players take turns placing stones of their own color on empty points of the board, one stone per turn.

It's illegal to make a weak connection to a certain stone unless it's impossible to make a placement which is both strongly connected to that stone and not weakly connected to another.

It's also illegal to form a crosscut, i.e. a 2x2 pattern of stones consisting of two diagonally adjacent Black stones and two diagonally adjacent White stones.

If a player can't make a move on his turn, he must pass. Passing is otherwise not allowed. There will always be a move available to at least one of the players.

The game is won by the player who completes a chain of his color touching the two opposite board edges of his color. Draws are not possible.


Pie rule

The pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means that White will have the option, on his first turn only, to change sides instead of making a regular move.

123214.name: Role-Playing Database
123214.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Do you play table top RPGs and would you like to dump that messy notebook?


The Role Playing Database can reduce your messy notebook of character sheets, maps, spell sheets, monster descriptions, and other essential information you need to drag around to your games with a USB memory stick! Yes, be prepared for a game anywhere there is a computer with an USB connector!
The Role Playing Database helps you keep track of player and non-player characters, including the character’s attributes and characteristics as well as the character’s personality and possessions. The Role Playing Database is compatible with most role playing systems, including the D20 system. Monsters of all types can be created and managed. Spells, tricks & traps can all be created and managed (and even shared!). Adventure maps can be created and kept up-to-date. All sorts of treasures can be hidden throughout your role playing world. It is even possible to to provide furnishings.

Included on the RPGDB CD is Donna’s Body Shop, a collection of images of bodies, heads, and facial parts (hair, noses, mouths, and eyes). These parts can be combined to form self-portraits of player characters (and non-player characters too).

123215.name: Les Royaumes Combattants
123215.description:
6th century BC, China does not yet have a name and seven kingdoms are fighting the mandate of heaven: the right to rule over the rising empire.

The game turn consists of nine phases. Those are moving priors, development, production, policy, recruitment, commercial, Science, movement (and battles), counts during the player move his game-pieces, take actions according the cards or draw tiles.

During the counts, player must feed itself and pay the balance of forces. Each province not be able to eat or pay will receive a token of revolt. After 2 tokens of revolt, player loses that province.
Also players earn civilization points during this phase.
1 point per province owned
1 point per occupied capital
1 point per level of development in most developed
1 point for general
3 points per wall funded
-1 Point for each pair of tokens of revolt

The game ends after one player has accumulated at least 50 points. Whoever has the most points wins.

123216.name: Fool's Paradise
123216.description:
From the website:

Lost Treasures: Fool's Paradise is a compilation of magical artifacts (both major and minor) that are usable within any Fortune's Fool game. Fool's Paradise brings you a a handful of lucky charms and trinkets that will make your character more lucky!

123217.description:
The board for this Edition is based on a map of France.
As with other Ticket to Ride games, players are collecting sets of cards to claim routes necessary to complete destination tickets.
123217.name: Extension France (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)

123218.name: Creatures of Thedas: The Wyvern
123218.description:
publisher blurb

Dragon Age RPG DLC! Creatures of Thedas: The Wyvern

Infamous for ferocity, the wyverns of Thedas are legendary to commoner and king alike. Bring these fearsome creatures from the "Mark of the Assassin" video-game DLC to your Dragon Age tabletop RPG campaign with this PDF containing complete statistics, game-world lore, and information on the notorious and rare hallucinogenic liquor concocted from wyvern venom. The newest entry in the Dragon Age RPG DLC series is here!

123219.description:
Oddly enough, several of you have been hired to build the city of OddVille, home to four powerful worker guilds.

Cleverly place your buildings in order to obtain greater power and fame, while thwarting your opponents' plans. Manage your workers to obtain the resources, coins, and building projects you need in order to make your mark on the city. Plan the city streets to get access to resources or coins from nearby buildings, even if not yours.

Impress the right guild, and you will get a visit from a guild member, who will gladly help you out while enjoying your hospitality. The guild comes first, though: At a moment's notice, every guild member will return to the guild hall, regardless of how much that inconveniences you. Of course, the person who "inspired" the guild meeting may be chuckling gleefully at the "unfortunate" timing of your guest's departure.

OddVille is a card-based city-building game in which all actions are carried out by playing one of your four Worker cards. Each Worker card has a different power and can be used in different ways: to get a project, to obtain resources, or to collect coins. During your turn, you can either play a card or add a building to the city. Connect it to adjacent buildings with roads and you will gain their bonus.

The city grows with each player's contribution, ever changing the values of players' buildings. As soon as a player builds his sixth building, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.
123219.name: OddVille
boardgamepodcastepisode: Heavy Cardboard Episode 59 – December (2016) Briefing

123220.name: Scratches
123220.description:
Scratches is a mystery and horror adventure computer game by game developer Nucleosys. Scratches is the first commercial adventure game ever to be made in Argentina.

The game tells the story of the Blackwood estate on the outskirts of Rothbury, a small rural town in Northumberland, England in 1976. Originally owned by James T. Blackwood in 1963, the house is passed to Christopher Milton after Mr. Blackwood is accused of murdering his wife. A couple of days later, Mr. Blackwood dies of a sudden heart attack though some in the town rumor he might have committed suicide. The police decide to close the case seeing there is no further evidence left. Shortly after acquiring the house, Milton inexplicably disappears in 1970 leaving no visible trace. The player assumes the role of the house's next inhabitant, Michael Arthate, an author seeking seclusion to work on his next book. He moves in only to find that the house still echoes its horrible past quite literally as scratches are heard all around, particularly in the basement and fireplaces, and soon becomes more interested in researching the house's history than his writing.

Scratches uses a first person perspective to navigate around the house. Using only a mouse, the player can access various rooms and other places in order to solve the mystery of both Blackwood and Milton's disappearances. It features music and special sound effects by Cellar of Rats,[1] which contribute to the fearsome ambience experienced at the mansion, crypt, greenhouse and church.

Source: Wikipedia, "Scratches (video game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123222.name: Yu-Gi-Oh! The Dawn of Destiny
123222.description:
Yu-Gi-Oh! The Dawn of Destiny is a strategy video game developed by KCEJ and published by Konami. It was released exclusively for Xbox on March 23, 2004 in North America, and November 19, 2004 in Europe. Marking the debut of the Yu-Gi-Oh franchise on the Xbox, Yu-Gi-Oh! The Dawn of Destiny brings the world of the popular trading card game to Xbox owners. The game features over 1,000 of the latest Yu-Gi-Oh! cards and seamlessly integrates the Yu-Gi-Oh! trading card gameplay and rules with beautiful 3D monster battles. The Dawn of Destiny also includes new duel modes such as Link Duel mode and Triple Duel mode, where players' can test their skills against three duelists.

Source: Wikipedia, "Yu-Gi-Oh! The Dawn of Destiny", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123223.name: Pike & Shotte
123223.description:
From Warlord Games website:

"Pike & Shotte is Warlord Games' third rulebook publication. It is a beautiful book in its own right with hundreds of colour photo of the most exquisitely painted model soldiers taken from the world s foremost collections. The rule book's intention is to inspire a collector to play gentlemanly games with their collections of soldiers with friends where the emphasis is on the spirit of the period, not the letter of the rule. It is a hearty publication and not for nitpickers or miseries. There are some good gags in it, but it also plays well and enables players to conduct a very big battle in a reasonable period of time, leaving them more time to chat about the highs and lows and what ifs..."

Pike & Shotte closes the gap that Warlord Games left between the "Hail Caesar" and the "Black Powder" rulebooks. Using the hallmark Warlord Games orders system (a player must state what his units are about to do, then make a leadership roll dice to check the efficiency with whom of the order given is received), with a 3-phases turn modality that clearly brings the Rick Priestley firm, the game is very smooth, fast and less detailed and mechanic than its stronger competitor, the Field of Glory Renaissance system.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
123224.name: Down the Shadowvein
123224.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Down the Shadowvein is an OSRIC(tm) module designed for 6-10 adventures of levels 3-5. It is a follow-up adventure for Advanced Adventures #1: Pod-Caverns of the Sinister Shroom, but it can be played alone.

You carefully load your canoes and launch into the fast-moving waters of the underground river named Shadowvein. The Pod-Caverns of the Sinister Shroom behind you, the veracity of the map that is to be your guide into the dark unknown will soon be tested. Hopefully what is written is accurate, but if it is not, your wits, wile, and brawn should serve you well as you journey down the Shadowvein!

Down the Shadowvein picks up where The Pod Caverns of the Sinister Shroom left off, but it can be played by those who have not explored that module. Down the Shadowvein continues in The Mouth of the Shadowvein.

123225.description:
Disaster on Kangchenjunga (or "K13" for short) is the third game in Tom Decker's 'Disaster on' series.

A plane has crashed high up on the slopes of Kangchenjunga, the world’s third highest mountain. One of the passengers was carrying plans that contain secrets that if exposed or delivered into the wrong hands, could threaten world security. Your nation has sent you to join an expedition intent on reaching the summit of Kangchenjunga (Kangch), but you have different orders. You must reach the plane wreck, find the secret plans, and continue the expedition as if you are just one of the team. However, there is a spy among you who will try to sabotage your efforts and steal the plans away from you. There may also be another nation’s team on the mountain with similar interests. It’s a race to the plane crash!

The game begins at midnight at High Camp on Kangch. You will control the movements for your entire team, most of whom are trying to reach the summit. Each turn, you will move climbers towards the summit (and plane crash) and then back down again. However, at some point in the game, the spy will be revealed, changing the rules drastically and forcing you to make decisions about who will summit, who will find and protect the secret plans, and who will try to just survive!

Your decisions will not only determine the lives of your climbers, but may also stop the Cold War from heating up. Think you have what it takes? Play Disaster on Kangchenjunga to find out!
123225.name: Disaster on Kangchenjunga
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Gaming Gang Episode 42: Disaster on Kangchenjunga, Wu Xing RPG, Epic Spell Wars, Phoenix Comicon, 10 Rules to Better Con Going, and More!

123226.name: UNO: Limited Too It's A Girl's World
123226.description:
From the box: Pack your bags and get ready for fun with the Limited Too edition of Uno! 110 Custom Cards featuring the Limited Too crew exploring their favorite cities with their best friends. Same great Uno play plus the exclusive Around the World card that allows players to travel to a new place and gain an edge on their opponents.

Summary: Just like standard Uno. The Around the World card allows you to swap all hands left, right or across, player's choice, and also choose the color like a Wild card.

123227.name: The Bible Adventure Game
123227.description: User summary: Roll and advance along a board by answering Bible trivia questions. Questions have three levels of difficulty. Game also has Gift and Peril cards that can reward or hinder your progress. Other spaces cause you to change spaces with another player or roll again. Game board also has a bridge that can be used as a shortcut, but you have to roll the correct number. First player to finish wins.

123228.description:
Bling Bling Gemstone features the same game play as Justin Oh's Toc Toc Woodman, but now players have more to aim for when they're swinging the axe.

To set up the game, players create a pillar of discs, with each disc having four colored plastic "gem" pieces slid into notches on its side. On a player's turn, the player takes two swings at the disc tower with a plastic pickaxe. If any gems or discs fall from the tower, the player must keep them. Red gems are worth 3 points, pink gems 2, and transparent gems 1, while the center disc is worth -10 points.

When no gems remain in the tower, the game ends and the player with the most points wins!
123228.name: Bling Bling Gemstone
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 97-- March Madness Filler Tournament

123229.name: Fantasy Adventures for Kids
123229.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Fantasy Adventures for Kids is a simple and fun fantasy roleplaying game designed to play an adventure in about an hour. Your children will explore dark dungeons in order to destroy evil monsters and find treasure and magic items. This game was designed for parents that want a quick and beautiful way to introduce their kids to the wonderful world of roleplaying games. Each of the nine characters in the game is fully illustrated and comes with a paper miniature so your children can move their characters around the table. All the monsters are fully illustrated with cute pictures that will not scare your younger children and they also come with paper miniatures so battles can be played out on the tabletop in full color.

123230.name: Castle of Blood
123230.description:
From the Introduction:

Castle of Blood is an adventure module for Fantasy Adventurers for Kids. It is designed for a party of three to five adventures, so the GM must play the role of extra adventures if there are not enough players.

A massive black castle sits on top of the mountaintop that overlooks the village of Valestein. The entire countryside surrounding the castle is shrouded in eternal night and all its villagers cower in fear wondering who will be the next victim. Every night a shadowy figure comes down to the village and leaves one of the villagers completely drained of all his or her blood. The adventurers must attack the dark castle and destroy the evil force that lies within. The entire castle is surrounded by deadly thorned vines that will kill anything that touches them. After talking with the villagers, the adventurers will find out that there is an ancient sewer system underneath Castle Valestein that might be a way inside.

123231.name: National Park Wit
123231.description: One of a series of Wit trivia games, National Park Wit has 105 cards with questions about National Parks. On the back of each card is a different photo from a National Park and a point value from 1-10 and 15. On the front of each card are three trivia questions and answers, as well as a description of the picture on the back. In turn, each player is asked a question of the asker's choice from the three on the card. If he gets the question right, he keeps the card. If he gets it wrong, all other players in turn (except the question reader) are given a chance. If all fail, the card is placed in the so-called "stumper" pile. After all cards have been asked, the stumper pile is revisited. Then, all players add up their points and he with the highest points wins.

123232.name: Yellowstone Wit
123232.description: One of a series of Wit trivia games, Yellowstone Wit has 105 cards with questions about Yellowstone. On the back of each card is a photo of something found in Yellowstone (Lower Falls, Old Faithful, brown bear, Mammoth Hot Springs, big horn sheep, Morning Glory Pool, elk, Castle Geyser, bison, a meadow, geyser, stagecoach and hotel, swan and mud pot) and a point value from 1-10 or 15. On the front of each card is a trivia question and answer. In turn, each player is asked a question. If he gets the question right, they keep the card. If he gets it wrong, all other players in turn (except the question reader) are given a chance. If all fail, the card is placed in the so-called "stumper" pile. After all cards have been asked, the stumper pile is revisited. Then, all players add up their points and he with the highest points wins.

123233.name: Le cirque de Lulu
123233.description:
"Lulu circus" in English.

Each player receives a different illustration representing the circus spectacle.
They must find all the misplaced items.
A player draw a tile with an item.
Each player must then find it in his picture as soon as possible.
The first who shout "Given Lulu!" wins the tile.

The player who has the most tiles when all objects were found wins the game.

123235.name: Une partie de pêche
123235.description:
Who will be the best fisherman?

Fish or worms? In his turn, players tries catch some fish with a fishing rod. You may get fish but You may get worms.
They roll dice and the color determine the fish: goldfish, yellow, blue, green or purple fish? To win the fishing contest, you must be the first to catch 5 fish.

123236.name: Try-Angles
123236.description:
Abstract game. There are 16 plastic triangular pieces and each turn you must add one to the table in Triominos fashion, that is, one against another, but not just matching numbers you must also match colours.

First person to use all their dominos, wins.

123237.name: Castel Cartes
123237.description:
Players is building the castle by playing cards.

In his turn player places his cards on the table to match the colors on cards already placed for scoring maximum points.

He scores as many points how long is the edge of the castle in this color

The winner is the player who scores the most points at the end of the game.

123238.name: Botanicula
videogamehonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best Indie Video Game Nominee
2012 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Winner
2012 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee
2012 IndieCade Best Story/World Design of the Year Winner
123238.description:
Botanicula is point-'n'-click exploration game created by Jaromír Plachý and Amanita Design. It’s about a bunch of five friends — little tree creatures who set out for a journey to save the last seed from their home tree, which is infested by evil parasites. The original soundtrack and sound effects are created by Czech alternative band DVA.

Source: The Developer Website.

One of the language options for the game's interface is Botulo, which is a made-up language for the game.

boardgamehonor: 2012/Fall Parents' Choice Fun Stuff Award Winner
2013 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
123239.description:
Wits & Wagers Party, a simplified version of the most award-winning party game in history, comes with 250 of the best questions from the out-of-print Wits & Wagers Expansion Pack 1. These questions were chosen because they are lighter and more fun than the questions from the original Wits & Wagers, making this the best edition to play with your non-gamer friends and family. The poker chips in this edition are twice as heavy and thick as those from the original W&W.

How to Play
1) Someone reads a question.
2) Everyone writes down a guess.
3) The guesses are placed face up on the table and ordered smallest to largest.
4) Players place their Betting Tokens on the guess they think is closest to the right answer.

Players score one poker chip for a correct bet or for having the closest guess. On the seventh and final question, players can bet their poker chips. The player with the most poker chips after this question wins.
123239.name: Wits & Wagers Party
boardgameaccessory: Wits & Wagers (Original and Deluxe Edition) Question Pack
Wits & Wagers Family Edition Question Pack
Wits & Wagers Party Edition Question Pack
boardgamepodcastepisode: #35: Fabled Fruit on tap; Six Pack of Games for the Holidays

123240.name: Neocron
123240.description:
User Summary

Neocron was a massive-multiplayer game that featured a first-person perspective and a lot of ranged combat set in a post-apocalyptic future world. Due to the release of Neocron 2 and the low amount of active players the game servers were shutdown in 2005.

123241.name: Barrier
123241.description:
Barrier is similar to Ludo/Pachisi. It is a roll and move game in which you try to get all your counters round the board before your opponents, however you can also use your counters to form barriers (by stacking multiple counters on top of each other). Forming a barrier blocks your opponents from moving past until they roll an exact number (which reduces your barrier by 1). The downside of this is that your barrier counters can not move, but can be disbanded at any time.

The game is played in teams of 2, and your roll can count for either you or your partner. Partners must be formed form opposite colours (i.e. red & yellow, blue & green, orange & purple). Both partners can contribute to a single barrier or create separate barriers. Landing on an opponents counter sends it back to the start.

The strategy of the game revolves around 6 key points:
1) Where to build barriers for the best effect
2) When to build barriers
3) When to break barriers
4) The order of colours in the barrier
5) When not to 'knock off' your opponents counters
6) How to keep counters moving

The rules also allow for the length of the game to be altered. Each counter each person has equates to 30 minutes game play - meaning a game where each person has 4 counters lasts 2 hours, a 6 counter game will last 3 hours. It is not recommended to play with less than 4 counters each, due to the need to create barriers.

123242.name: TumblePop
123242.description:
Tumblepop (タンブル・ポップ?) is an arcade game by Data East released in 1991. It is considered a cult classic, and was later ported to the Nintendo Game Boy.

The game involves one or two ghost-busters who can suck monsters, ghosts, aliens and various other oddball characters into vacuum-cleaner-like devices and spit them back as bouncing/rolling balls. Expelled enemies function as projectiles that can damage and kill other opponents on the screen when colliding with them. The game's looks are reminiscent of Pang. Throughout the game, the player/s can collect letters of the alphabet found in randomly appearing bubbles in order to gradually spell the word "TUMBLEPOP", the progress of which is permanently displayed at the bottom of the screen. When completed, players are transported to a bonus level which gives them the opportunity to obtain higher scores and an extra live, although this level is strictly timed. The word goes back to default after completion.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tumblepop", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123243.name: Sacrificial Limb
123243.description:
From the publisher website:

Sacrificial Limb: Boardroom Backstabs 2 (Adventure)

In 2072, Roger Soaring Owl, CEO of Knight Errant, resigned.
In 2073, Roger Soaring Owl was attacked on the streets of Denver. Witnesses were not clear on just what attacked him, but most say it was meaner, stronger, and faster than any metahuman.
Now it’s 2074. It’s time to find out what Roger Soaring Owl learned.
Corporate machinations don’t get any meaner than this. Rivals of the megacorporation are certain it’s hiding some dark secrets, and they’re willing to spend significant nuyen to uncover this information. Runners are going to have to infiltrate an Ares subsidiary and gain the corporation’s trust if they want to discover the secret—and if they do, they will have to find a way to survive with what they have learned.
Sacrificial Limb is the second in the Boardroom Backstabs series of adventures for Shadowrun. It has plot information, NPC details, player handouts, and everything needed to throw players into the depths of corporate espionage, digging for the paydata the megacorps want to keep hidden.

123244.name: Hazard Pay
123244.description:
From the publisher website:

Hazard Pay (Deep Shadows)
Dark alleys, abandoned buildings, wet streets stabbed with neon light—shadowrunners know all these places. They also know that they aren’t the only places work gets done. A good shadowrunner should be open to anything, to runs that might take them anywhere. From the cold of Antarctica to the heat of the Sahara, from the life-filled dark of the deep oceans to the empty void of outer space, there is work to be had for runners brave and resourceful enough to take it. Of course, there are also dozens of new ways to die, so you should probably see if Mr. Johnson will chip in a little extra pay.
Hazard Pay takes shadowrunners into different extreme environments across the Sixth World, providing the descriptions, plot hooks, gear, and other information gamemasters and players need to use these environments in their game. From mysterious monuments under the sea to battered jalopies that just might make it into orbit without disintegrating, Hazard Pay presents myriad challenges for runners who are prepared for trouble and ready for anything.

123245.name: Character Deck
123245.description:
UNPUBLISHED PRODUCT




it appears this Item will never be published
this Item has been moved to (Unpublished Products)
there should be no product images submitted to this entry




From the publisher website:

Character Deck (Game Aid)
Fortunes have been made with the right fall of the cards. Now your Shadowrun game can be equally as fortunate. The Character Deck is a collection of cards with all necessary information on a variety of characters presented in an easy-to-use format. Whether you need a quick NPC or are introducing a player to Shadowrun for the first time, the Character Deck makes it easy to select a character, throw them into action, and track the effects. Their laminated surfaces allow you to easily mark down damage, Edge use, and other info, then wipe them clean when you’re ready.
Clearly organized, full of useful information, and presented with eye-catching art, the Character Deck makes Shadowrun faster and more fun than ever. Need top-notch security, a skilled social adept, a Dawkins Group operative, or an expert spellslinger? The Character Deck presents these options and more in an easy-to-use format.


admin comment
this Item was added to RPGG in April 2012
there are no listed owners
moved to (Unpublished Products) on August 19, 2016

123246.name: Civilization V: Gods & Kings
videogamehonor: 2012 Golden Joystick Best Strategy Game of the Year Winner
123246.description:
Gods & Kings is set to include 27 new units, 13 new buildings, 9 new wonders, and 9 new playable civilizations. A new religion mechanic featuring a "faith" resource will allow players to found their own religion which they can grow to a "world-spanning fully customized religion." Diplomacy has been reworked to include espionage, foreign embassies, and new types of city-states (religious and mercantile). City-states will also feature a new quest system and strategic importance. Additionally, the combat system has been re-worked to include smarter AI, an expanded early modern era, and enhanced naval combat featuring Great Admiral and melee naval units.

Three new scenarios will be included in the expansion: "The Fall of Rome", focusing on the decline of the Roman Empire; "Into the Renaissance", focusing on religion in the Middle Ages into the Renaissance era; and "Empire of the Smokey Skies", a Victorian steampunk scenario.

Source: Wikipedia, "Civilization V: Gods & Kings", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123247.name: The Clutch of Dragons
123247.description:
From the publishers website:

The Clutch of Dragons (Deep Shadows)

Never, ever deal with a dragon. Shadowrunners have heard that dictum so often, they frequently say those words in their sleep. But what the aphorism forgets to tell you is this—what if you don’t have a choice?

The tension between dragons has been growing, and the big lizards are throwing every weapon they have at each other, including shadowrunners—especially shadowrunners. Extractions, industrial sabotage, theft, wetwork—there’s plenty of work in all of those areas, and dragons are finding ways to hire the help they need. Maybe they’ll hide their involvement in the run, or maybe they’ll bribe the runners with large piles of nuyen or blackmail them with their past activities. Or maybe they’ll just tell the runners they have a simple choice of working for them or being eaten.
Whatever tactics they choose, the dragons are going to be active and aggressive, and if runners want to survive, they better be on their toes. They need to know who the draconic players are, what they’re up to, and what might happen to them if they fall into a dragon’s grip. They need to be ready for anything, because when dragons go at each other, the world shakes, the earth beneath them burns—and far too often, shadowrunners die.
The Clutch of Dragons provides the information gamemasters and players need to involve draconic plots in their games, from profiles of individuals dragons, their plots, and their lairs to information about the latest efforts to build anti-dragon weapons. This is a critical reference for any players who want to test their skills against the machinations of dragons—or who want to see just how much trouble they can survive.

123248.name: Battle of Manhattan
123248.description:
From the publishers website:

The Battle For Manhattan: Boardroom Backstabs 3 (Adventure)

TO: Willing recruits
FROM: The people who can pay you
Come to Manhattan. We will pay.
We won’t bother with appeals to patriotism, or to your best instincts, or to anything the least bit noble. Come to Manhattan because there is a fight breaking out. Fighting is what you are paid for. Fighting is what you were born for. Come because there is money to be made.
You don’t need to pick a side. Sides shift, sides change. In the end, the only consistent thing is that you are the only one you can count on. You fight for yourself. That is something you should be used to. That is how you live.
Come to Manhattan because the corporations are spoiling for a fight. Most of the time, we’re good at keeping our spats clean and civilized. We lie, we cheat, we steal, but we do not engage in anything as vulgar as open street fighting. Sometimes, though, we can’t help ourselves. Sometimes, the tension gets to be too much, and it breaks, and it bursts into the open.
That time is coming.
Bring your skills, bring your wits, and definitely bring your guns. You’ll need everything you got. We are anxious to take advantage of what you have.
Come to Manhattan. We’re waiting for you.
The Battle of Manhattan is the third in the Boardroom Backstabs series of adventures.

More publisher blurp:

Requires Shadowrun, Twentieth Anniversary Edition; offers the character statistics, setting information, and plot points needed for gamemasters to take players on the third in a series of adventures that develops one of the classic Shadowrun themes—corporate machinations and double-crosses. This adventure presents both danger and opportunity to the player characters as corporate intrigue spills into open fighting in the streets of Manhattan.

Selling Points:
• Brings runners to Manhattan and involves them in ever-increasing corporate tensions that threaten to erupt into violence.
• Puts the runners in situations that will test the limits of their abilities, including a daring mid-air extraction.
• Ratchets up the tension of the first two adventures in the series and tests the runners’ ability to succeed in a hostile setting.
• Builds on plotlines, characters, and situations covered in previous books such as Corporate Guide and the Missions living campaign while developing plotlines that will be expanded on in future books.
• Can be played alone or as the start of the Boardroom Backstabs series, which will have ramifications in the ongoing Shadowrun plotline.
• Provides complete non-player character statistics, player handouts, and all other information needed to let players dive into the adventure immediately.

Latest publisher blurp:
Come to Manhattan. We will pay.

We won’t bother with appeals to patriotism, or to your best instincts, or to anything the least bit noble. Come to Manhattan because there is a fight breaking out. Fighting is what you are paid for. Fighting is what you were born for. Come because there is money to be made.

You don’t need to pick a side. Sides shift, sides change. In the end, the only consistent thing is that you are the only one you can count on. You fight for yourself. That is something you should be used to. That is how you live.

Come to Manhattan because the corporations are spoiling for a fight. Most of the time, we’re good at keeping our spats clean and civilized. We lie, we cheat, we steal, but we do not engage in anything as vulgar as open street fighting. Sometimes, though, we can’t help ourselves. Sometimes, the tension gets to be too much, and it breaks, and it bursts into the open.
That time is coming.

Bring your skills, bring your wits, and definitely bring your guns. You’ll need everything you got. We are anxious to take advantage of what you have.

Come to Manhattan. We’re waiting for you.

The Battle of Manhattan is the third in the Boardroom Backstabs series of adventures; includes stats that allow it to be compatible for both Shadowrun, Fifth Edition and Shadowrun, Twentieth Anniversary Edition.

123249.name: Sprawl Sites: North America
123249.description:
From the publishers website:

Unfold the World
The Sixth World is full of dark alleys, twisted corridors, and hidden locations for nefarious activities. Shadowrunners and 16th century explorers both know the same truth—the difference between death and survival when entering a hazardous area may be a good map.
Sprawl Sites: North America presents eight full-color maps that can be used in a variety of sprawls, making it simple for gamemasters to call up a number of different locations when they need it. From a luxury hotel to a collection of blocks in an urban barrens, from a shopping mall to a trideo studio, the collection includes maps that can be used in many different situations. The maps are double-sided, with a key on one side, making them useful as both a guide for players and a reference for gamemasters. The package also includes a booklet providing details on security and other personnel found in the location, along with plot hooks to help involve these spots in your game.

Sprawl Sites: North America is for use with Shadowrun, Twentieth Anniversary Edition.

123250.name: Shadowrun 2050
rpghonor: 2013 ENnie for Best Supplement - Gold Winner
123250.description:
From the publishers website:

Rewind and Reload

Chrome eyes. Computers called “decks.” Big hair, big cyberlimbs and bigger guns. It’s Shadowrun in the year it all started. Take a step back to Shadowrun’s roots with Shadowrun 2050, a book that combines Fourth Edition rules—the smoothest, most accessible rule set Shadowrun has ever had—with the setting that first made the Sixth World a legend.

Shadowrun 2050 has everything players and gamemasters need to dive into the grimy beauty that kicked off one of the greatest roleplaying settings of all time. With information on how to adapt Fourth Edition Matrix, gear, and magic rules for the 2050 setting, as well as in-universe information about the powers of the world, what shadowrunners will be up to, and who they’ll be running into, Shadowrun 2050 puts a new twist on the classic setting.

Captain Chaos. Maria Mercurial. The Laughing Man. Sally Tsung. JetBlack. Hatchetman. Nightfire. And the Shadowland poster who just called himself The Big “D.” These people and many others are waiting for you in the year that started it all, a setting brought back to life with new, full-color artwork showing the chrome, dirt, neon, and darkness that was in the heart of Shadowrun when it started and remains at its core today.

Shadowrun 2050 is for use with Shadowrun, Twentieth Anniversary Edition.

boardgamecompilation: Cartoona: Expansions – includes Heads on Tails and Long Necks
123251.description:
The Heads on Tails Expansion includes 3 new tail tiles for the Cartoona game. But these are not regular tails, these are little head tails that will allow you to build two-headed creatures!

This expansion will also include 3 new cards:

Use a tail head as a main head or vice versa
+4 to any tail head tile
Use a tail head as front or back feet




This expansion will allow you to build even wackier creatures, and it also changes the game slightly to make 7 and 8 tile creatures easier to complete.
123251.name: Cartoona: Heads on Tails Expansion

123252.name: Advanced Quick20
123252.description:
From the RPG description here on RPGGeek:

Advanced Quick20 isn’t really all that advanced. The game is designed for experienced GMs who want an easy to play system where you can generate characters quickly, explain the rules in a few minutes and get down to gaming. It’s also a high trust system. That means it assumes that the players are there to help each other have fun and are willing to compromise for the sake of running a good session.

The rules provide a rough level of balance, but I’ve left quite a bit for the group to determine. How far can you stretch a role? What exactly can you apply advances to? What are the limits of the magic system? I have my answers for each question — but they aren’t always going to be the same as yours. Use this book as a starting point. Don’t worry about the rough edges too much. As you play, you’ll find solutions that are comfortable for you.

123253.name: Codex: Story Gaming for Creative People
123253.description:
From the RPG Description here on RPGGeek:

Codex is an RPG for writers and other creators who want to use games as a medium to create a world and share stories within it. In Codex, a picture, short story or poem can simultaneously describe a part of the world and a character attribute. Blue, Green and Red books let players develop a cohesive setting for themselves.

A simple yet broad system determines the fates of individuals, groups and even entire nations. The conflict systems cover duels of wit, furious sword fights and massive propaganda campaigns.

Although Codex is designed for your own characters and world, the game includes the city of Eight Gates as an example setting. Use it -- or add it to your own world. You can use Codex as a complete RPG or you can use it to manage the fictional content of other games. It's especially suited to text-based games, including those played by forum or weblog.

123254.name: Achtung! Cthulhu: Assault on the Mountains of Madness
rpg: Expeditions: Return To The Mountains of Madness
123254.description:
UNPUBLISHED PRODUCT




it appears this Item will never be published
this Item has been moved to (Unpublished Products)
there should be no product images submitted to this entry




from the publisher

Achtung! Cthulhu brings you a two-fisted wartime roleplaying game setting packed full of fiendish Nazi scientists, terrifying ancient mysteries, legendary German war machines, desperate partisans, gun-toting paratroopers, determined investigators, and enough writhing tentacles to pack ten Reichstags.

Discover the secret history of World War Two - stories of the amazing heroism which struggled to overthrow a nightmare alliance of science and the occult, of frightening inhuman conspiracies from the depths of time, and the unbelievable war machines which were the product of Nazi scientific genius - and how close we all came to a slithering end!

Play a huge range of classic wartime heroes such as Russian political officers, German U-Boat commanders, British commandoes, RAF pilots, US rangers, Washington investigators, London journalists, Hollywood starlets, and resistance fighters from all across Europe, who must all unite in the battle against the darker side of World War Two.

Achtung! Cthulhu - The Mountains of Madness sees a return to Lovecraft's infamous Antarctic world and is set during the opening shots of WW2. A hastily assembled Allied expedition must pursue the Nazi war machine deep into the Antartic to discover the secrets of a lost continent and confront a terrifying reality.

The game will thrust your characters in to the midst of a dark and desperate struggle, as Cthulhu's minions take advantage of the chaos wrought by the Third Reich to topple civilization! The massive world-spanning Achtung! Cthulhu setting features occult conspiracies, terrifying Nazi war machines, and an ancient evil so powerful that it threatens to tear the world apart!

Achtung Cthulhu! is also a setting available for other popular roleplaying systems however this release uses Expeditions, a brand new standalone roleplaying system designed to introduce new friends to roleplaying. Featuring complete rules for exciting roleplaying adventures in World War 2, as well as equipping company-sized expeditions to confront the horrors unleashed!


admin comment
moved to (Unpublished Products) on August 23, 2016
this Item had been added to the database in April 2012
with the success and demands of other products by the publisher, this product may have become unneeded

123255.name: Alien Angels
123255.description:
From the introduction:

The Basics

Since the earliest days of space travel it has been one of Man’s fondest dreams to discover life beyond our Solar system – especially if that life is drop-dead gorgeous. Alien Angels is a game wherein that dream comes true, albeit in an unexpected manner.

Imagine a world much like the real world. People have the same struggles, natural disasters threaten many and political turmoil is rampant. Now add one extra ingredient; extraterrestrials are real. They walk the Earth in human guise, living and working alongside us, with no one knowing who and what they are. But this invasion differs from B-movie alien attacks in two important respects. One, these aliens have come not to conquer but to move in. No ships will fill the skies, and no death rays will incinerate all who oppose the newcomers from the stars. This war is one of quiet infiltration. Second, all of these invaders are young females. The reason for this provides the central conflict of the game.

123256.name: Apokryph
123256.description:
User Summary:

A French roleplaying game, set in modern times, where characters are agents of the Catholic Church (members of the clergy or laymen) trying to fight Evil and averting the impending rise of the Antichrist. The system is based on percentile dice, heavily influenced by the Call of Cthulhu RPG.

123257.name: GettaLife
123257.description:
Money, adventure, & success in thirty minutes or less!

GettaLife is a fun card game illustrating the universal aspects of every day life. Players will draw and play cards to their individual Life Grid while simultaneously blocking their opponents from building theirs. As players build their Life Grid, they accumulate points, and after the deck runs out, the game ends and the player with the most points is crowned the winner and has GottaLife!

During play, however, players will also play Hard Knocks cards on their opponents' Life Grids in order to slow down their own progress, and will even play Damage cards on their opponents. Life Grids consist of four different tracks, or suits: Relationships, Wealth, Knowledge, and Experience. Each player must build the best Life Grid possible by balancing the development of all four suits with the hope of playing the Legend card and multiplying their points. Of course, the crowning achievement for any suit is for the player to achieve knighthood in one of their suits by playing all four cards in one suit without having any Hard Knocks.

123258.name: Bring Out Your Gods
123258.description:
From the Introduction:
Introduction
Bring Out Your Gods is an RPG set in the ancient world, spanning
from ancient Greece to Egypt. The empires have been untouched by
gods for centuries, but the gods are coming. Most of these gods were
long forgotten or erased. But during their time, they were all powerful, they
were gods. And oh yes, they have animal heads.
Setting
Bring Out Your Gods takes place in the ancient world, spanning
from ancient Greece, with its city states and Olympian gods, to Egypt with
its pyramids and animal gods, all the way to china and its zodiac of gods.
You may begin wherever you wish, but it’s probably a good idea for your
GM to have the game start somewhere where they have a decent
knowledge of the locales and people. That is, if you want to be accurate,
but that’s only optional.
Gods
The players are gods. New gods, gods who on day simply awoke
with a new head, the head of a beast. These gods are superhuman in
everyway, but they are not true gods. They do not come born with the
great godly powers that the old gods have. They are only better than a
human in every way, shape, and form.
Governments quickly accepted the existence of these gods, but
there is still a mystery about them. Kings and Pharaohs fear them for their
powers, for their ability to uproot them. The people see them as either
enemies, especially to the gods who simply ravage the country side for
the hell of it, or they see them as saviors, for those who heal the wounded
and feed the hungry.
You can be any of these things: a savior or a devil, a king or a
beggar. But you are surely at least a god.

123259.name: The Centre of the Universe
123259.description:
From the RPG Description here on RPGGeek:

The Centre of the Universe is an alternate Fantasy RPG where both the meek and mighty work magick while the Gunslinger works his six shooters; where the Adventurer creeps into the bowels of a shadowy tower on the edge of Nowhere, and the mighty Sentinel stands firm in the haunted halls of the Labyrinth. You live in the heart the Maker's creation, the Centre of the Universe, but be ever vigilant for the agents of the Unmaker because the shadow always seeks to blot out the light.

This is stand alone product includes all you need for full campaign play.

An easy to understand game engine, fueled by the d6.
Eight different profiles from the Adventurer to the Gun Slinger, from the Dream Crafter to the Sentinel.
A open-ended magick system, complete with the Colleges of Magick, artifacts and items.
A bestiary of creatures that lurk in the shadows of the Centre of the Universe.
A comprehensive section on the Invisible Kingdom and the things that dwell there.
A full world section.
A technology section that covers some of the weird and wondrous machines found in the Centre of the Universe.
And lots more.

The Centre of the Universe lightly blends fantasy and technology in a world fit for your imagination.

123260.description:
Plan, build, and develop a small town into a major metropolis. Use hex-shaped building tiles to add residential, commercial, civic, and industrial areas, as well as special points of interest that provide benefits and take advantage of the resources of nearby towns. Your goal is to have your borough thrive and end up with a greater population than any of your opponents.

Suburbia is a tile-laying game in which each player tries to build up an economic engine and infrastructure that will be initially self-sufficient, and eventually become both profitable and encourage population growth. As your town grows, you'll modify both your income and your reputation. As your income increases, you'll have more cash on hand to purchase better and more valuable buildings, such as an international airport or a high rise office building. As your reputation increases, you'll gain more and more population (and the winner at the end of the game is the player with the largest population).

During each game, players compete for several unique goals that offer an additional population boost – and the buildings available in each game vary, so you'll never play the same game twice!
123260.name: Suburbia
boardgamepodcastepisode: #116 – Tabletop – Ted Alspach

All Us Geeks Interview With Ted Alspach
