123417.name: Bagatelle
boardgamefamily: The Legend of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table
boardgameartist: Eelco Martinus ten Harmsen van der Beek
boardgameversion: House of Marbles White Box Edition
123417.description:
A bagatelle board resembles a light, flat board with nails (pins!) in it and short raised sides to keep the ball on the playfield during play. Each ball is launched from some sort of spring-loaded 'shooter' or cue, to the top of the board, where it then rolls towards the player, bouncing off the pins or landing in any of several scoring pockets. These scoring pockets can be depressions in the playfield, nails arranged in a U-shape, or both. They are marked with various score values, with the higher values usually protected by more pins or tougher paths to reach them. By "shooting" the ball harder or softer, the player can try to control where the ball drops.

A spring-loaded shooter is normally in the bottom right corner of the board. A ball is placed before the shooter mechanism. The shooter devise is pulled back and let go, with the aim to fire the ball up to the rounded end of the board and then to bounce around the nails or pins and, hopefully, land in a scoring area. A cue shooter is just a wooden object, rather like a miniature version of a Billiards cue. To launch a ball, the player merely shoots it by hitting the back of the ball with the cue thus sending it to the top of the board.

Note that it is possible for a ball not to score at all. This usually means that the ball reached the bottom of the board without settling into a scoring pocket.

Typically, a player might get 3 or more balls and a note of the total score achieved is taken. The first to reach a pre-agreed number of points, wins.

Bagatelle sets can be made of wood, metal or plastic and they can be of any size (but it must be able to stand on an average table). They are often linked to a theme, really as an excuse to feature related graphics. The game is a direct ancestor of modern Pinball machines.

123418.name: Soul of a Robot
123418.description:
Soul of a Robot is a computer game sequel to Nonterraqueous for the ZX Spectrum, Amstrad CPC and MSX, released by Mastertronic developed by Stephen N Curtis and Mark Jacobs. It was sometimes called Nonterraqueous 2.

The attempt to destroy the rogue computer from Nonterraqueous failed. Now the computer threatens to self-destruct with old age, taking the planet Nonterraqueous with it. The people of the planet create another robot, one with the mind of a man. On a kamikaze mission to the computer's core, it must locate the three keys to allow it to transport to the next section, before self-destructing inside the computer's core.

Gameplay is rather different from the prequel Nonterraqueous. The robot which is controlled by the player does not "fly" like in the previous game but leaps rather like an ordinary platform game. However, the ability to fly is available in the game, and necessary to complete it. The robot still has a "psyche" value which must not be allowed to decrease to zero and which decreases with certain actions. The "laser" from the previous game also remains.

The game was considered much more difficult than its prequel, relying on perfectly-timed and aimed jumps (the player is able to choose five "strengths" of jump) in order to progress, and enjoyed much less commercial success. The gameplay was much slower and jumps and flying can take a lot of time and effort to perform correctly. There also seems to be a certain influence from Underwurlde in the gameplay and sounds used in the game. Soul of a Robot was also a much smaller game, the map containing only a third as many individual screens as its prequel, with only 256 rooms.

Source: Wikipedia, "Soul of a Robot", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123419.name: Gyroscope
123419.description:
Gyroscope is an action video game published by Melbourne House in 1985 for a number of home computers. It is based on the Atari arcade game Marble Madness.

The gameplay is very similar to Marble Madness except the player controls a spinning gyroscope rather than a marble. Melbourne House would go on to publish the official Atari ports of Marble Madness (DeLuxe Edition) for the ZX Spectrum and Amstrad CPC but these were entirely new versions, unconnected to Gyroscope (being coded by John F. Cain rather than the Catalyst Coders).

The game is presented in isometric 3D. The player must guide the gyroscope from the top of the course to the bottom within an allotted time limit. If the gyroscope topples off the edge, a life is lost. Hazards on the course include potholes, aliens and glass slopes which cause the gyroscope to spin in random directions. There are five courses comprising four screens each. The gyroscope had to land on a marked square to complete each level.

Source: Wikipedia, "Gyroscope (computer game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123420.name: Terrormolinos
123420.description:
Terrormolinos is a text adventure developed by Trevor Lever and Peter Jones, written with a modified version of The Quill.

The game revolves around surviving a package holiday to the Spanish resort of Terrormolinos (a play on Torremolinos) and bringing back home ten snapshots. The user takes the role of the husband and goes away on a package holiday with wife Beryl, and two kids, Ken and Doreen. To successfully complete the game, a player must take aforementioned ten photographs to illustrate the "happy" holiday you've experienced.

Terrormolinos was a follow-up to Melbourne House's successful Hampstead, produced by the same team with almost identical interface, and using the same style of satirical humour. The magazine adverts for the game said, "Just When You Thought It Was Safe To Have A Holiday ...", referencing the famous tagline from Jaws 2.

Source: Wikipedia, "Terrormolinos", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123421.name: Pud Pud in Weird World
123421.description:
Pud Pud in Weird World (also known simply as Pud Pud) is a computer game published by Ocean Software in 1984 for the ZX Spectrum. Written by Jonathan Smith, who was paid £1000 for this game by Ocean Software and was given a job at Ocean as a direct result.

Pud Pud is trapped in Weird World and needs to escape. He must explore Weird World looking for ten puddings and avoiding the deadly kiss of Mrs Pud Pud.

The player controls Pud Pud (who resembles a round pudding with wings or feet depending on whether he's walking or flying) and must explore the maze-like Weird World. Pud Pud has a limited amount of energy which needs to be topped up by eating certain creatures that live in Weird World although other creatures, which drain his energy if eaten, must be avoided. If Pud Pud runs out of energy he loses one of his three lives. Mrs. Pud Pud occasionally appears on the screen and is similar to Pud Pud but white and wearing high heels. If she touches Pud Pud he loses a life instantly, regardless of his energy status although the player will receive a bonus score based on how much energy was remaining when Mrs Pud Pud delivered her kiss.

Pud Pud can obtain an extra life by collecting all ten hidden puddings. The puddings are spread randomly through the maze with only one being in the maze at a time. When all ten are collected, Pud Pud can escape Weird World.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pud Pud in Weird World", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123422.name: Rambo (1985 Cassette)
123422.description:
Rambo is based on the film Rambo: First Blood Part II. It was produced by Platinum Productions and published by Ocean Software for the ZX Spectrum, Amstrad CPC, and Commodore 64. The Commodore 64 version's music is by Martin Galway, incorporating melodies from the film's score.

The game is viewed from a semi-top down perspective, and follows the movies story. You, controlling Rambo, have to find your lost equipment, locate the POW camp, rescue the hostages and make it back to the extraction point, all while being pursued by constantly respawning enemies. You start off with just your Bowie knife and grenades (both of which have an unlimited supply, as with all the weapons), and gain points for killing the enemy, and for collecting Rambo's following equipment: Rocket Launcher, M16 Rifle, and your Bow & Arrows (Explosive & Non Explosive)

The game was one of the first to feature controllable vehicles (a helicopter), and also one of the first to feature stealth elements.

The Amstrad CPC and ZX Spectrum versions of the game was included on the 1986 compilation They Sold a Million 3,[9][10] along with Fighter Pilot, Ghostbusters, and Kung-Fu Master.

As of 2008, there is a remake available for the PC, with enhanced graphics, sound and music taken from the films theatrical score. Gameplay remains unchanged. Another difference is, that the enemies are more plentiful than the original.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rambo (1985 video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.ocean

123423.name: Kirel
123423.description:
Kirel is an isometric 3D puzzle arcade game game developed by Siegfried Kurtz. As "Kirel", you must defuse the bombs before they explode while evading monsters which will sap his energy.

The player controls Kirel, an alien creature in a world made of blocks and inhabited by monsters. Bombs have been set in each level and Kirel must reach and defuse them before they explode. Kirel can pick up blocks and drop them. He cannot jump higher than one block so must build staircases to reach high places. He cannot descend heights greater than one block, however if he picks up the block or item on which he stands, he will safely fall to the lower level regardless of drop.

He can build a limited number of horizontal Bridges to traverse gaps. (Remaining Bridges are indicated at bottom left of the screen.)

Kirel cannot pick up blocks from the base level, nor place blocks on the top level. He cannot pick up the block upon which the Exit door will eventually appear. He can carry only one block at a time.

Monsters move randomly around the map and will drain Kirel's energy if they climb on him. Kirel can kill them in turn by climbing on them, but this costs him Pieces of Cake. (Remaining Pieces are indicated at bottom left of the screen.) If a monster is on the highest level of the map then it cannot be killed. Nor can Kirel be attacked in that position.

Various objects are scattered around the landscape:
Pieces of Cake enable Kirel to kill monsters
Arrows give Kirel extra Bridges
Sweets (resembling cupcakes, toasters, and pies) restore Kirel's energy
Balls slow down the Bomb fuse
Teleports transport Kirel to other parts of the map
Pyramids block Kirel's path and cannot be moved (later levels also feature invisible Pyramids)
Cubes destroy sections of the map and enable access to hidden bombs

When all the Bombs have been defused an Exit door will appear to take Kirel to the next level.

A training mode is available to introduce new players to the game, since Kirel has a complex control system which must be mastered if the game is to be played successfully:
S = Start game (bypass scrolling intro screen)
Fire or 0 = pick up or drop block
1 = Rotate view 90 degrees clockwise
2 = Rotate view 180 degrees
3 = Rotate view 90 degrees counter-clockwise
H = Pause game (Enter resumes)
Space = Pause game and show location of Kirel and the monsters (Enter resumes)
B = Build bridge in direction Kirel is facing (if possible)
D = Move vertically down (if possible)
E = Move vertically up (if possible)
V+T = Abort game

Source: Wikipedia, "Kirel", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123424.name: Super Locomotive
123424.description:
Super Locomotive is a train arcade video game developed by Sega and released in 1982.

The objective of the game is to guide a train from one station to next. Along the route, the player must avoid obstacles such as other trains, planes, red signals, trucks crossing intersections, and guide the train along multiple routes by changing tracks en-route. The player is armed with a steam fire bullet for destroying airborne targets, and a temporary force field which protects the train for a limited period of time. The use of the bullets and shields rapidly deplete an energy bar which must be maintained between levels by picking up oil items en-route. Upon completion of a level, a bonus stage is played which involves the train attempting to shoot as many airborne enemies within a finite time limited. The bonus awarded is dependent upon the number of enemies destroyed. The game then resumes on more challenging levels.

The game features a rendition of "Rydeen" (1979) by Yellow Magic Orchestra playing throughout the main gameplay.

The game was reported to have a very limited production run with only 35 PCB boards printed. Of those, most remained in Japan, with the remainder exported to Sega Europe and all sold to UK customers. This means that the game was not natively present in either mainland Europe or the US. This makes the game one of the most sought after boards, and prices reflect this scarcity.

While no official conversions of the game exist, the game Loco is heavily influenced by the concepts introduced in the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Locomotive", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Loco is a 1984 computer game developed by Antony Crowther for release by Alligata for the Commodore 64. In 1986 it was converted for the ZX Spectrum and Atari 8-bit family.

The ZX Spectrum version was developed by Richard Stevenson, David Wright and Nigel Speight. The music for the game is a C64 remake of Jean Michel Jarre's Equinoxe 5 by Ben Daglish.

Comparing screen shots and game descriptions, Loco appears to be a clone of the arcade game Super Locomotive, produced by Sega in 1982.

Source: Wikipedia, "Loco (computer game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123425.name: Graham Gooch's Test Cricket
123425.description:
Graham Gooch's Test Cricket is a 1985 cricket game released for the Acorn Electron, BBC Micro, Commodore 64 and ZX Spectrum by Audiogenic. It was later reissued by budget label Alternative Software as Graham Gooch's Match Cricket.

Graham Gooch's Test Cricket has two modes of play, arcade and simulation:
Arcade mode is for one player where the player picks the type of match and the players. During the match the player controls the action. When batting the player can move the batsman around the crease and choose the shot to play. Timing is important to performing the shot successfully.
Simulation mode is where the player can make tactical decisions but the actual play is done by the computer. The player can only watch the game, and make decisions on how his team plays.

Source: Wikipedia, "Graham Gooch's Test Cricket", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123426.name: Moonlight Madness
123426.description:
Moonlight Madness, developed by John F. Cain, is an arcade adventure game in which players control a boy scout.

Players must navigate a 43-room mansion in order to obtain 16 keys and a combination before running out of time. These unlock a safe containing the pills needed to save the mansion owner's life. It is necessary to jump onto platforms and evade enemies in order to progress. At the start of the game the player has three lives; a life is lost should the boy scout fall too far or come into contact with one of the mansion's servants or traps. Rooms contain doors that can be entered to move around the mansion, as well as push buttons and hazards. Pressing buttons can result in lifts being activated, platforms appearing or in an enemy appearing. One of the mansion's rooms is a corridor of eight doors with a large pair of eyes above them; this room acts as a maze. A tune is played continuously during play, but can be toggled on or off.

The player character, a boy scout, has approached a mansion looking for work during Bob a Job week. The door is answered by an old man wearing horn-rimmed glasses—the owner of the mansion. The man, a mad scientist, expresses surprise that the boy has managed to get past the guards and booby traps in the mansion's grounds. As the boy scout explains the reason for his visit, the scientist collapses, asking for his pills. At this point the game begins. The player must gather the 16 keys needed to unlock the safe and retrieve the scientist's pills before he passes away. During play the boy scout must negotiate the mansion's rooms, avoiding hazards and the mansion's staff, who have been told to protect the inventions within the mansion, using lethal force if necessary. The staff are unaware of the boy scout's purpose and will attack him should they come into contact.

Source: Wikipedia, "Moonlight Madness (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123427.name: The Boggit: Bored Too
123427.description:
The Boggit: Bored Too is a text adventure game by Delta 4 released in 1986 for the Commodore 64, Amstrad CPC and ZX Spectrum home computers. The game is a parody of the J.R.R. Tolkien novel The Hobbit and of the earlier game based upon it also called The Hobbit. It is the prequel to Bored of the Rings.

Bimbo Faggins and Grandalf must find treasure, solve puzzles, and appear on a gameshow. The game is a standard text adventure with basic graphics to set the scene.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Boggit", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123428.name: Vampire Saga: Pandora's Box
123428.description:
User Summary

Vampire Saga: Pandora's Box is a hidden object adventure game played from two perspectives, one in 1950, and one in 1898. The game opens with the protagonist, Ty, receiving a panicked phone call from his grandfather, who thinks he's going crazy and may have "killed her." Ty goes to investigate when his grandfather hangs up.

123429.name: La Terre des Dieux
123429.description:
Priest of Apollo, Athena, Demeter, Poseidon or Zeus, 3-5 players try to make their worship the one who will dominate the whole of Greece. As you gather up YOur followers, build monumental temples, free the cities of mythological monsters, use your political weapons for your own benefit.

The game consists three phases:

Action Phase
Agora Phase
Stage season




In his turn in first phase player places his followers to build temples, gather resources and hunt monsters to get more followers.

Also it is possible to convert opponents' cities, or even paralyze them by sending Your monsters to attack them.

In Agora Phase player deifies his heroes, who offer more improved actions for the action phase

Finally the season phase is a phase of replacement.

Player must meet at least 10 worshipers ( or have Three shrines before the end of the game to be the winner of the game.

123430.name: Valkyrie
123430.description:
Valkyrie is a game of checkers with 2 boards. One is Midgard (Earth), the other Asgard (heaven). When the game starts, each player has three gods and a Valkyrie on first board 9 troops (human or monsters) on the second board.

Player wins the battle if he eliminate 3 opponent's gods or has last man standing on the second board.

In his turn player has 2 actions/movements according to the following rules:

troops move one square in the 8 directions
the gods move one square orthogonally and never back
the Valkyries move freely on the set except the last line.




If the move ends on square with an opponent the battle begins.

The value of a pawn in combat is equal to the value of the piece (5 for the gods, 1 to 3 for the troops).

The Valkyries may move a troop from one world to another if it stands one of the adjacent square.

123431.name: Shogun: Rise Of The Renegade
123431.description:
"Shogun: Rise Of The Renegade is a shoot’em up inspired by japanese arcade games of the 90’s. We created this game as a tribute to the manic shooters (aka bullet hell) but enhanced with a modern, touch based game-interface and easy to read graphics.

Classic bullet-hell shooting action
Pixel perfect retro design atop hi-res 3D backgrounds
HD Graphics
Superb Electro-rock soundtrack by French band Yubaba Smith & Fortune
Witty bosses with humourous lines
Bullet-time weapon menu
Available on iOS (iPhone/iPad+iCade), Android & bada
Worldwide, cross-platform leaderboard"

Source: The Game Website.

123432.name: Siege Towers For Two
123432.description:
"Step into the medieval battle and build the higher Siege Tower to take over the enemy castle! In this fast and fun game made for two players sharing an iPad or Android tablet, your task sounds simple: drag the wood, spikes and cannons onto your wheeled base platform so that you'll end up constructing the higher tower. There's only three things in your way to an easy win: gravity, a ticking clock... and the other player, who is trying to build an even higher tower and whose cannons are directed at you!"

Source: The Developer Website.

123433.name: Star Wake
123433.description:
"A cool game for you.

Allow multiplayers! You can play with your friends through the Bluetooth®.


When you wake up in an unknown area of the space.



What will you do?



Ha!



Now here's your journey.



Find any possible way to survive in this game.



It'll be amazing!


How to play this game?!

1. Design Mode: Design your spacecraft in this mode. You can built whatever shapes you like. And don't forget to choose your favorite color and choose a wise value for you spaceship.

2. VS Mode: Fight with your friends with the ship you designed, just for fun!

3. Survive Mode: It won't so easy to survive in this mode, just find a way to avoid to be killed by enemies. Try your best to live longer.

4. Awake Mode: Find your challenges in the unknow space and win your achievements."

Source: The Developer Website.

123434.name: Graf Zeppelin
123434.description:
German game celebrating Germany's fame, as they were once the leading airship manufacturer in the world.

The game is a simple roll and move game, taking your Zeppelin across Europe and visiting the major cities. Obey instructions if you land on special spaces. First to the end of the track, wins.

Undoubtedly seen as an educational game, teaching children about their neighbouring countries as well as their aeronautical history.

123435.name: Acorn Electron
123435.description:
The Acorn Electron is a budget version of the BBC Micro educational/home computer made by Acorn Computers Ltd. It has 32 kilobytes of RAM, and its ROM includes BBC BASIC along with its operating system.

The Electron was able to save and load programs onto audio cassette via a supplied converter cable that connected it to any standard tape recorder that had the correct sockets. It was capable of basic graphics, and could display onto either a television set, a colour (RGB) monitor or a "green screen" monitor.

At its peak, the Electron was the third best selling micro in the United Kingdom, and total lifetime game sales for the Electron exceeded those of the BBC Micro. There are at least 500 known games for the Electron and the true total is probably in the thousands[citation needed].

The hardware of the BBC Micro was emulated by a single customized ULA chip designed by Acorn. It had feature limitations such as being unable to output more than one channel of sound where the BBC was capable of three-way polyphony (plus one noise channel) and the inability to provide teletext mode.

The ULA controlled memory access and was able to provide 32K × 8 bits of addressable RAM using 4 × 64K × 1-bit RAM chips (4164). Due to needing two accesses to each chip instead of one, and the complications of the video hardware also needing access, reading or writing RAM was much slower than on the BBC Micro. This meant that although ROM applications ran at the same speed, there was a substantial speed decrease on applications running from RAM.

The Electron was developed during 1983 as a cheap sibling for the BBC Micro with the intention of capturing the low-cost Christmas sales market for that year. Although Acorn were able to shrink substantially the same functionality as the BBC into just one chip, manufacturing problems meant that very few machines were available for the Christmas period — to the extent that some shops reported eight presales for every delivered machine.

This was a blow from which the machine never fully recovered, although games sales for it would ultimately outstrip those of the BBC Micro. Following Olivetti's 1985 cash injection into Acorn the machine was effectively sidelined.

With hindsight, the machine lacked the RAM (a typical program would need to fit in only around 20 kB once display memory is subtracted) and processing power to take on the prevailing Sinclair ZX Spectrum and Commodore 64. Despite this, several features that would later be associated with BBC Master and Archimedes were first features of Electron expansion units, including ROM cartridge slots and the Advanced Disc Filing System — a hierarchical improvement to the BBC's original Disc Filing System.

Whilst it may not have been as popular as the Spectrum, Commodore 64 or Amstrad CPC, it did sell in sufficient numbers to ensure that new software was being produced right up until the early 1990s. This meant the Electron had a lifespan not much shorter than those more popular micros and much longer than competitors such as the Oric-1 and Dragon 32.

Source: Wikipedia, "Acorn Electron", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123436.name: BBC Micro
123436.description:
The BBC Microcomputer System, or BBC Micro, was a series of microcomputers and associated peripherals designed and built by Acorn Computers for the BBC Computer Literacy Project, operated by the British Broadcasting Corporation. Designed with an emphasis on education, it was notable for its ruggedness, expandability and the quality of its operating system.

Following the Literacy Project's call for bids for a computer to accompany the TV programmes and literature, Acorn won the contract with the Proton, a successor to its Atom computer prototyped at short notice. Renamed the BBC Micro, the platform was adopted by most schools and became a cornerstone of computing in British education in the 1980s, changing Acorn's fortunes. It was also moderately successful as a home computer in the United Kingdom despite its high cost. Acorn directly employed the machine to simulate and develop the ARM architecture which sees widespread use in embedded systems as of 2012.

Source: Wikipedia, "BBC Micro", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123437.name: Ars Mag (Issue 15 - Jul 1998)
rpgissuearticle: La Combe à la Serpent : Intersaison
La Combe à la Serpent : L'affrontement
La Combe à la Serpent : La menace
123437.description:
Pour info
Édito
La Combe à la Serpent : Intersaison
La Combe à la Serpent : L'affrontement
La Combe à la Serpent : La menace
Les Aventures du Chevalier Couard
L’Alliance de Delphes
Dangereux Festival
L'Habitat au XIIIème Siècle
Portrait de famille

123438.name: Ars Mag (Issue 16 - Nov 1998)
rpgissuearticle: Des changements de la 3ème à la 4ème édition
La Combe à la Serpent : Acte III
La Combe à la Serpent : L'énigme
La Combe à la Serpent : L'illumination
Les hommes d'armes au XIIIème siècle
123438.description:
Pour info
Édito
La Combe à la Serpent : Acte III
La Combe à la Serpent : L'illumination
La Combe à la Serpent : L'énigme
Les hommes d'armes au XIIIème siècle
Des changements de la 3ème à la 4ème édition
Anders le Montreur d'Ours
Errata au Wizard's Grimoire (RE)
Portrait de famille

123439.name: Modern Armor: Miniatures Rules for AFV's of the Contemporary Era
123439.description:
Modern Armor is a set of miniatures rules "based on U.S. Army doctrine and the combat experiences of the author." The information is based on unclassified 1976-77 data.
The game is set up to be used with 25mm or 1/76 scale vehicles, but 1/285 scale micro-mini tanks are just as easily accommodated with minor adjustments.
The game can use simultaneous movement with written orders, or a move/countermove system.
In addition to Armor, rules include Indirect Fire, Small-Arms Fire, Infantry, Morale, Smoke, Amphibious Capabilities, Repair and Recovery of Vehicles, Airborne Operations, Armed Helicopters, and Air Strikes.

123440.name: Three Little Pigs: The Game
123440.description:
Take on the role of one of the Three Little Pigs as you try to build a house strong enough before the Big Bad Wolf arrives to blow it down and eat you. Move around the board collecting straw, sticks, and/or bricks and then bring them back to your building site to build your house before the big bad wolf arrives. Will you risk travelling further to get to the brick pile, or build a house of straw quickly and then sit back and relax counting on luck to save you when the big bad wolf comes calling.

Watch out, your brother pigs can steal what you’ve collected before you get it back to your house or speed up the wolf’s approach. The pigs whose houses still stand at the end of the game are the winners.

Extra points are awarded for being lazy, but they only matter if your house can survive the coming wolf.

Do you want to take your chances by building a house of straw?

Do you have the time to gather the bricks for your house before the wolf arrives?

Are your brother pigs going to steal your bricks before you can get them back to your house?

Move fast and be smart or it won't matter how much hair you have on your chinny chin chin.

123441.name: Grand National
123441.description:
Horse racing game that takes its game-play from the traditional British card game of Racing Aces.

The cards are shuffled and a number are taken out of the deck and revealed to the players. In the race, cards will be revealed and the horse in that racing colours will advance one space. This is done for each card revealed until one horse crosses the finish line.

It will be seen that some horses will have less cards in the pack than others. This is because when you take out the cards before the race begins, those cards are no longer in the pack, so the horses affected have less cards available and thus have less chance of winning. The odds for them to win will be higher than the odds om horses with, for example, all their cards still in the deck.

Players bet on each race and after a pre-agreed number of races, the player with most money, wins.

John Rickman, British television's eccentric horse racing expert, pictured on the box.

123442.name: Edna & Harvey: The Breakout
123442.description:
User Summary

Edna bricht aus ist ein 2008 von Daedalic Entertainment und Xider herausgegebenes Point-and-Click-Grafik-Adventure, das sich von der Bedienung und Inhalt an klassischen Adventures orientiert. Das Spiel erhielt aufgrund der originellen Rätsel und der skurrilen Handlung positive Kritiken.

Edna bricht aus beginnt damit, dass der Hauptcharakter Edna in einer Gummizelle aufwacht. Sie hat ihre Erinnerungen komplett verloren und weiß weder, wie sie in die Zelle gelangt ist, noch warum sie überhaupt in einer Irrenanstalt ist. Sie ist aber fest davon überzeugt, nicht verrückt zu sein. Ihr einziger Freund ist ihr blauer Stoffhase Harvey, mit dem sie sich unterhalten kann. Außerdem hilft er ihr, zunächst aus ihrer Zelle und später aus der Anstalt zu entkommen, weil er ihr beim Anblick bestimmter Gegenstände zu Flashbacks verhilft (im Spiel tempomorphen genannt), mit denen sie sich an ihre Kindheit und insbesondere an damals erworbene Fähigkeiten erinnert.


Edna & Harvey: The Breakout is a 2008 point-and-click graphic adventure created by Daedalic Entertainment and Xider Games that plays like many classic adventure games. The game's original puzzles and its bizarre plot garnered positive reviews.

The game begins when the main character, Edna, wakes up in a padded cell. She has lost her memory completely and knows neither how she got into the cell, nor why she is even in a mental institution. But she is convinced she isn't crazy. Her only friend is her blue stuffed toy bunny Harvey, with whom she talks. In addition, Harvey helps her out of her cell and later to escape from the hospital through interactive flashbacks (called tempomorphing in the game), through which she remembers her childhood and in particular the skills she acquired during that time.

123443.name: Generations
123443.description:
Game that tries to encourage people into the hobby of Genealogy, ancestor hunting you might say.

Generations is a board game with playing method which uses logic reasoning (in this regard, very similar to Cluedo) to solve a mystery of family history. Players search 7 regions of the United States for their make-believe ancestors, U.S. birthplaces, careers and lifestyles.

The first player to complete a family history (i.e. work out which facts are hidden, by eliminating facts that have been revealed to that player), wins.

Several game options ensure that play never becomes boring and that different levels of skill can be achieved. Variations include:
Logic Reasoning: Adapt for the time you have and the playing skill levels by varying the number of search categories. .
Storytelling: At the end of the game, the winner can make up a story about the discovered ancestor's life using "facts" found during play. This variation develops imagination and communication skills.
True Family History: Introduce players to real family stories as they "travel" regions of the United States asking questions about their pretend ancestors, where they were born, how they may have lived and how they earned their living.

Contents;
playing instructions (for home and classroom)
game board
moving pieces
dice
cards
lifestyle tokens
career tokens
ancestor worksheets
realistic family tree charts

123444.name: Counter Intelligence
123444.description:
You are the Spymaster of a team of agents -- Your Mission is to penetrate the Control Centre and seize the Master Modules hidden there. BUT... Counter intelligence sourses have discovered that a rival power has despatched a team of ruthless Agents to oppose you.
You must direct your team to the control Centre via an international network of safe houses. En route, you must eliminate the opposition whilst avoiding their murderous attempts on your agents.

Essentially a game where you plot movement on your board and try to work out where the enemy is on his board. Lots of guessing and bluffing needed. The winner is the first player to capture any one piece of the five Master Module pieces. You can also win if you are the lone survivor.

A triumph of design, nothing is wasted. The game comes in a leatherette wallet, the pieces are magnetic and stick to the player boards and the rules are on the back of these boards. The boards and components are suitably dark and sinister for a game about espionage.

Contents
2 Dossiers
36 Spy Counters
6 Target Counters
5 Master Modules

123445.name: Top Tennis
123445.description:
Statistical tennis game, espec ially designed to get a result quickly, thus making it possible to play an event in one evening. Over 200 players are rated.

Verious statistics are provided, like ability, ranking, serving, etc., and a die is used to get a specific result for an action you have just attempted.

123446.name: LoveSick
123446.description:
From the back of the box:

Love Sick is an quick and fun card game about venereal diseases (STDs) – and how to avoid them. .

In the game the players try to avoid a pile of disease cards - called ”the wad” - which passes around the table. If you have the right card or a condom, you can pass it on – otherwise you’ll get infected. The winner is the player with the fewest disease cards at the end of the game.

LoveSick is designed for use when teaching teenagers about sex and sexual health and it shows in an entertaining and alternative way how condoms can protect you from STDs. It’s full of important knowledge about STDs and sexuality, and it can be used both as a break from class teaching or as a foundation for talking about sex.

123447.name: Cross Chess
123447.description: Australian Chess variant played on a chequered board in the shape of a cross. Each side has 16 pieces but four pawns are larger than the other four. This designates them as either King's pawns or Queen's pawns. Bishops only play on black squares. Almost all other rules are standard chess rules and objectives.

123448.name: One Day International
123448.description:
Statistical cricket game with over 120 players rated in areas like batting, bowling and fielding. When this was designed, One Day International matches would last for 50 overs to be bowled by both sides. There is a certain hit and hope element when compared to full Test Matches. In 50 overs you don't have time to build an innings. So a player's One Day rating will be very different to a player's Test Match rating. This designer designed games for both codes of cricket.

Play is straightforward. A player metaphorically bowls a ball which has to be checked with dice against his rating, to see the outcome. Then a batsman rolls dice, against his batting ability, to see if he has hit it. Chances of 'Outs' could be decided by a briiliant delivery, or a mis-timed hit or a fantastic bit of fielding.

123449.name: Ski Race / Go For Goal
123449.description:
Two games in one box, the only link being that they are both designed to help 7 to 11 year-olds with their maths.

Ski Race is a dice game with four special dice that have very unusual number spreads on them. Children are encouraged to do simple maths with the numbers rolled and thus advance in the Ski Race.

Go For Goal is a football related game for 2 players only. Each player has a hand of cards and must use them (with some simple mathematics) to move the ball around the pich.

The publisher is a major name when it comes to publishing books for budding Hi-Tech students.

123450.name: Professor Crocodile's Safari School
123450.description:
In Safari School you have to give the animals the right characteristics before your opponents.

Choose between 22 characteristics such as "Got wings" and "Eats plants". The first player who reach 15 points wins.

Other variations are possible depending on the number of players.

123451.name: Goblin-Prügelparty
123451.description:
"Goblin-Prügelparty" (Goblin-Beatingparty) is a Fantasy-cardgame in which two players take control of Goblins, kobolds and little devils, who enjoy beating up each other, after they have been summoned by a wizard who was not powerful enough to take control of them.
Players start with 3 cards on their hands and have to decide which cards to play for themselves and which to play for the opponent. Playing cards for the opponent may seem odd, but it is the only way to gain new cards. And since 11 cards in one of the card-rows end the game, you will need some more cards than the 3 you start with if you don't want the game to end early.
Nearly every single one of the 30 cards contains a unique effect, but while some of these effects are executed immediately, others wait for the end of the game before beeing executed. And you can't be completely sure whether they will be in the same position on the same side at that moment.
When the end is declared and the last effects have been executed, it is time to count the strenght and see who has collected the stronger - or more effective - little horde.

123452.name: Aventuras en la Marca del Este Basic Core Rulebook (Pocket edition)
rpg: Aventuras en la Marca del Este
123452.description:
publisher blurb

Aventuras en la Marca del Este (Adventures in the East Mark) was born in the minds of the creators of the eponymous blog as a project that returns to the most rabid present the style of the great glories of RPGs. An undertaking of this magnitude could only be addressed from an absolute dedication and utmost care of every detail, and so demonstrate their exquisite illustrations and fantastic layout. And this is not just words, just take a look at the material that gradually have been published on his blog, to the delight of all who await the arrival of the game.

The game is published by Holocubierta Ediciones, a spanish RPG publisher founded on October 2.010.

This book's first edition was published on September 2011

rpgitemversion: Aventuras en la Marca del Este: La Caja Roja
123454.name: Aventuras en la Marca del Este: Red Box
rpg: Aventuras en la Marca del Este
123454.description:
publisher blurb

Aventuras en la Marca del Este (Adventures in the East Mark) was born in the minds of the creators of the eponymous blog as a project that returns to the most rabid present the style of the great glories of RPGs. An undertaking of this magnitude could only be addressed from an absolute dedication and utmost care of every detail, and so demonstrate their exquisite illustrations and fantastic layout. And this is not just words, just take a look at the material that gradually have been published on his blog, to the delight of all who await the arrival of the game.

The game is published by Holocubierta Ediciones, a spanish RPG publisher founded on October 2.010.

The box includes the core rulebook, a game master screen, a set of dice and a pencil.

rpg: Aventuras en la Marca del Este
123455.name: Aventuras en la Marca del Este:  Blue Box (Official Setting)
123455.description:
publisher blurb

Aventuras en la Marca del Este (Adventures in the East Mark) was born in the minds of the creators of the eponymous blog as a project that returns to the most rabid present the style of the great glories of RPGs. An undertaking of this magnitude could only be addressed from an absolute dedication and utmost care of every detail, and so demonstrate their exquisite illustrations and fantastic layout. And this is not just words, just take a look at the material that gradually have been published on his blog, to the delight of all who await the arrival of the game.

The game is published by Holocubierta Ediciones, a spanish RPG publisher founded on October 2.010.

This box's first edition was published on December 2011
The box contains a 247 pages setting including two adventures and a double-sided map.

123456.name: B4U: Hipster Battle Game
123456.description:
"B4U: Hipster Battle Game" is a simple 3-5 player card game where you try to play a card that has the highest "Irony" value out of your hand, or "Six Pack" as I like to refer to it. It's not as easy as all that though, because someone could play an event card that will completely throw the rules of that round a curve, making it anyone's game! This is a quick, and easy to learn and had a little snark to it as well. All you need to know how to do to play B4U is some simple math, and that's it.

How to play?

Gameplay is easy. As a round begins, you place two card facedown on the table. One in front of you, and one to your right. The card in front of you (which can either be a Irony card, or an Event card) will always come into play each round, but the one on the right (always an Irony card) may or may not.

After all necessary cards are placed into play, the card in front of everyone is turned over and exposed. In the simplest version of a round, the card played with the highest Irony value wins that round. If someone has played an Event card in the front position, then the round gets skewed in some fashion (explained on the card). Such things that could happen are the player with the lowest value wins, or you use the Irony value of both cards, etc.

When an event card is played, that is when the card to your right will be turned over. Some event cards also require you to play a third card onto the table.

After a winner for the round is determined, the round is over, and everyone puts any non-displayed cards back into their Six Pack, and draw back up to 6 cards if the Six Pack is not complete.

First player to win 7 rounds is the winner!

123457.name: The Rifter (Issue 52 - Oct 2010)
rpgissuearticle: From the Desk of Kevein Siembieda
123457.description:
The Rifter® is your doorway to unlimited imagination and numerous Palladium role-playing worlds. It offers new heroes, powers, weapons, magic and adventure for your games. It presents new villains, monsters and dangers to battle, and new ideas to consider.

Issue #52 Presents:

•Rifts®: The Crusaders & The Black Crusade™ - Source material for Rifts® based on a pair of interrelated short stories that appear this issue. Source material includes 35 new Magic Tattoos, a dozen new pieces of equipment and weapons, new variant Sunaj O.C.C.s and more.

•For the Palladium Fantasy RPG®: Cannibal Magic. Perfect material for our horror issue.

•For the Palladium Fantasy RPG®: From Ruins to Runes (easily adaptable to Rifts® and other other settings). Several completely new types of super-rare Rune Weapons from the Elf-Dwarf War.

•The latest chapter of Hammer of the Forge™, fiction.

•News, coming attractions and much more.

123458.name: The Rifter (Issue 53 - Jan 2011)
rpgissuearticle: A Dawn of a New Era
From the Desk of Kevin Siembieda
123458.description:
The Rifter® is your doorway to unlimited imagination and numerous Palladium role-playing worlds. It offers new heroes, powers, weapons, magic and adventure for your games. It presents new villains, monsters and dangers to battle, and new ideas to consider.

The Rifter® #53 includes:

•Ravages of Time, by S.E. Gibbons, is an interesting Rifts® article with tips for Game Masters and playing sprawling epic sagas like the Minion War™ and Siege on Tolkeen.

•ARCHIE Phase Two, by Damon Sutton. This Rifts article takes a look at more machinations of our favorite mechanized menace, ARCHIE Three™.

•On Faerie Folk, by Michael P. Yocom, offers up a menagerie of new Faerie Folk, cousins and animals for the Rifts® and Palladium Fantasy® settings.

•Dawn of a New Era, by Corey Livermore, presents an adventure in a setting for Heroes Unlimited™ in which mutants and aliens are being forced to "register" with global governments, or else.

•The Lucky Psychic, by Steven Dawes, presents a new Beyond the Supernatural™ psychic who makes his own luck.

•A Dark Day™ Short Story, by Jeremy Hutchins, will keep you wondering what's next.

•The next chapter of the Hammer of the Forge™.

•Plus news and coming attractions.

•Heroes Unlimited™ cover by Zachary Schoenbaum.

•More of the usual, but in addition to game material and fiction, you'll learn what Palladium has planned for 2011.

123459.name: Onekey
123459.description:
User Summary

In Onekey you do not control the character, rather the elements of the stage around him. Your character will continually walk forward until hitting a wall and then will turn around. You must help him to progress safely by utilizing springs, avoiding traps, enemy monsters, spikes and other obstacles. Gather bonus gems for even more points.

123460.name: One Button Bob
123460.description:
User Summary

Help Bob make it through the mysterious dungeon.
One Button Bob is a single key game, the action is controlled entirely by the left mouse button. In each are the mouse button will have different effects. Sometimes it will cause him to walk, sometimes to jump, sometimes to stand still, sometimes to climb a ladder and so on.

123461.name: The Scale of Things
123461.description:
From the Introduction (with some User editing)

An mini-adventure for fairly experienced, but still mostly mercenary or new to adventurer ranked characters. Characters with the following abilities should benefit/have a useful role:
Ranger; A Namer; An Assassin; and someone who can speak with the dead.

A coven of witches with their ogre, and other allies, is seeking to enslave great numbers of suarime, for sale to some demon backed individuals. Things having been going quite nicely until our hapless party blunder into them....

Note: This is a fan-created, free adventure.

123462.name: Epic Coaster
123462.description:
User Summary

Take control of a roller coaster on the most dangerous track imaginable, it's unfinished! Luckily for the passenger this roller coaster can jump. The game is played entirely with the mouse, and you will use the left mouse button to jump. The longer you hold the button down the farther you will jump. Score points the longer you last, as well as many opportunities for bonus points.

123463.name: A Common Sort of Metal
123463.description:
From the Introduction

A mini-adventure for adventurer, or near adventurer, rank characters.

A floundering metal galleon is encountered and the party stumble into some demonic politics between Murmur the Duke of Thrones and Sitri the Beautiful Prince....a bit like Hell-Raiser meets Dead Calm. In campaign play it is one of two ships used by some demonists for the transport of selected suarime captives.

Note: This is a fan-created, free adventure.

123464.name: The Rifter (Issue 54 - Apr 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Dawn of a New Era Part Two
From the Desk of Kevin Siembieda
123464.description:
The Rifter® #54
This is another landmark issue of The Rifter® filled with epic source material, exotic places, strange critters, adventure settings, good stories and ideas.

The Rifter® is your doorway to unlimited imagination and numerous Palladium role-playing worlds. It offers new heroes, powers, weapons, magic and adventure for your games. It presents new villains, monsters and dangers to battle, and new ideas to consider.

The Rifter® #54 includes:

•The Final Chapter of The Hammer of the Forge™, by James M.G. Cannon. The pulse-pounding conclusion of this epic tale.
•Dawn of a New Era, Part Two – Heroes Unlmited™.
•A Megaversal™ Menagerie – for many world settngs.
•The fortress city of New Chillicothe, Missouri – Rifts®.
•Dark Day™ Chronicles, Volume 2. A Nightbane® short story.
•News and coming attractions.
•Cover by Michael Leonard in honor of The Hammer of the Forge™.

123465.name: Citadel of Convenience
123465.description:
From the Introduction

A mini-adventure adventure for ranked characters. Characters with the more dungeon-based abilities and adepts will be of most benefit.

It is essential the party have a few magic weapons. By means of DragonNewts 1,2 and 3 the party should know of a scheme whereby a coven of witches captures suarime and they are transported away by a demonic powered ship. In this adventure the party find a transfer point in an old dwarven complex. It is guarded by powerful magic and cunning tricks. A powerful devil awaits any intruders who get too far...

Note: This is a fan-created, free adventure.

123466.name: Rendezvous of Silver
123466.description:
User Summary

This is an adventure for experienced Adventure class characters.

In their continuing quest to stop a group of powerful demonists the characters must travel to an island and seek entry to Bregor's tomb. They need to solve a number of riddles to succeed.

Note: This is a fan-created, free adventure.

123467.name: The Town of Eynsville Point
123467.description:
User Summary

In the conclusion of the DragonNewt series, the players face an inevitable battle with Issabaal the Sentinel to gain the forbidden knowledge she guards...

Note: This is a fan-created, free adventure.

123468.name: The Home Fires
123468.description:
User Summary

This is an introductory mini-scenario for the Dragonquest Majesty campaign.

The adventurers blunder into a ratmen hunting party that has itself gotten lost. One of them has a map leading to the cellar of an abandoned inn. In the cellar is a set of keys and another map the ratmen are supposed to retrieve. The clues lead to a barrow where a historically important stone tablet awaits rediscovery...

Note: This is a fan-created, free adventure.

123469.name: Darkwaters Run Deep
123469.description:
User Summary

This is a mini-scenario for Mercenary rank adventurers in the Dragonquest Majesty campaign.

Will the party survive when they find themselves caught between a famed band of adventurers and the last surviving follower of an Evil duke they've destroyed?

Note: This is a fan-created, free adventure.

123470.name: The Secret of Grisly Manor
123470.description:
"Grandpa always was a little eccentric. A fantastic engineer, he was always buried in his work, always coming up with new ideas and inventions that as a child held you wide-eyed in awe.

Now, after many years, you return to the house that holds so many fond memories for you, with a promise from Grandpa to show you something truly amazing. You can't even begin to imagine what it could be!

It's a dark and stormy night as you arrive at Grisly Manor. The rain beats down hard, lightning flashes in the sky as the sound of thunder fills your ears. You already feel a little creeped out, but when you make your way inside, the house is curiously empty. Grandpa is nowhere to be found!

But his presence is everywhere.

Familiar objects have been re-engineered to create puzzles for you. Clues abound, and as each puzzle is solved, the solution to others present themselves. As well as new puzzles, of course.

Grandpa obviously spent a lot of time making sure that nobody could solve the myriad of puzzles strewn about the house. Nobody but you, his favorite grandchild...

What would make Grandpa go to such extremes? What could be so important? Can you discover 'the secret of Grisly Manor'?"

Source: The Developer Website.

123471.name: Goblin Slayers
123471.description:
User Summary

This is a mini-scenario for Mercenary rank adventurers in the Dragonquest Majesty campaign.

Strange stories draw the adventures to the Dwarven North. A tribe of goblins are raiding villages and picking them clean down to every fork and spoon. Are they just methodical, or are the suffering from a curse?

Note: This is a fan-created, free adventure.

123472.name: Topple 2
123472.description:
"Stack and balance a family of mischievous and dysfunctional shapes using Multi-Touch™
controls to slide and rotate them into position. Build your way to victory but remember to keep your balance by tilting the screen to prevent your teetering tower of blocks from Toppling to their doom.


Enjoy beautiful visuals, playful animations and a sweeping musical score
Drag, rotate and stack pieces using touch and multi-touch controls
Tilt the screen to keep your teetering blocks from toppling
Follow your blocks' facial expressions for tactical clues and comic relief"


Source: The Developer Website.

123473.name: Jaw Bones
123473.description:
From the Introduction

The first of a series of "Extended Encounters" for Dragonquest Majesty. This is not quite long enough to be a mini-scenario, but should take longer to play than a single encounter.

A large hyena pack lives in the ruins of the homestead. In times past they were allied to a number of gnolls, one of them an adept of necromancy. His legacy still remains and assists in the great success of the pack. The party may have to fight the pack, but if they are clever of lucky, may not have much conflict. The party may gain some low value treasure.

This Extended Encounter may be used with DQMAJ1: The Home Fires.

Note: This is a fan-created, free adventure.

123474.name: Xmas March
123474.description:
User Summary

Xmas March is an increasingly difficult rhythm game, there are red, yellow and green chimneys and when a chimney moves into the touch zone, you have to let the chimney meet the beat box.

123475.name: She Who Must Be Obeyed
123475.description:
From the Introduction

The is an "Extended Encounter" for the Dragonquest Majesty campaign. This item is not quite long enough to be a mini-scenario, but should take longer to play than a single encounter.

There is a tradition that girls from the village must ask a nearby harpy for approval to marry their chosen spouse. If not, legend says, the harpy will swoop down and steal their firstborn child. Homage must be paid during the visit to the harpy including baskets of sugary fruits, live goats, and a story-teller to amuse and inform the harpy. The party will escort the girl, and provide entertainment for the harpy. If she is impressed she will ask a favor of the party in return for some magic amulets...

Note: This is a fan-created, free adventure.

123476.name: The Groundling
123476.description:
User Summary

The is an "Extended Encounter" for the Dragonquest Majesty campaign. This item is not quite long enough to be a mini-scenario, but should take longer to play than a single encounter.

There's more than meets the eye when the party is challenged by a rampaging minotaur...

Note: This is a fan-created, free adventure.

123477.name: Air Born
123477.description:
User Summary

The is an "Extended Encounter" for the Dragonquest Majesty campaign. This item is not quite long enough to be a mini-scenario, but should take longer to play than a single encounter.

When a friendly Roc tries to get the characters attention, the encounter leads to an intriguing side adventure where the characters find themselves fighting a hoard of gargoyles...

Note: This is a fan-created, free adventure.

123478.name: The Elf Caravan
123478.description:
From the Introduction

The is an "Extended Encounter" for the Dragonquest Majesty campaign. This item is not quite long enough to be a mini-scenario, but should take longer to play than a single encounter.

The party are lured to try the delights of an elven caravan and their houses of ill-repute. Games of archery, spell casting, and feats of arms await the bold or unwary. If the party prove to be competent enough in their day of games, in the night more sinister games occur..

Note: This is a fan-created, free adventure.

123479.name: The Wounded Wyvern
123479.description:
From the Introduction

The is an "Extended Encounter" for the DragonQuest Majesty campaign. This item is not quite long enough to be a mini-scenario, but should take longer to play than a single encounter.

A dwarf caravan reports it was attacked by a swooping dragon-like beast. They claim to have severely wounded it with a mounted ballista. They say the beast could hardly fly away, and that it will be easy to track. They will share any booty if the party track and kill it...

Note: This is a fan-created, free adventure.

123480.name: The Ghost Touched
123480.description:
From the Introduction

The is an "Extended Encounter" for the DragonQuest Majesty campaign. This item is not quite long enough to be a mini-scenario, but should take longer to play than a single encounter.

A spectral sphinx approaches the party saying the sanctity of his lair has been disturbed and his soul has been awakened in this ghostly form. A group of foul creatures are despoiling his hidden temple and place of eternity.

He begs the party to destroy these interlopers before they break into the depths of his lair, overcome riddles that guard him, and disturb his body. He offers them some of his vast hoard as a reward.

(This is the longest of the "Extended Encounters."

Note: This is a fan-created, free adventure.

123482.name: Sharad'
123482.description:
Players form two teams and each team chooses speaker.
The two speakers are placed side by side and they draws a card. There are words on the cards and speakers must explain it to players with the charades preferably more accessible to their own team.

The first team that sets the correct answer scores one point.

The game length is established before the game (10 points or 15 minutes). Winner is the team with the most points.

123483.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Bloody war rages across the Old World. While ancient enemies struggle, sweat, and bleed, Portent of Doom continues to develop the focus on material rewards for quests that pervades "The Bloodquest Cycle" for Warhammer: Invasion - The Card Game. The sixty cards (three copies each of twenty different cards) in this Battle Pack provide players their first Portent, as well as units, support cards, and tactics that hasten questing. Players also find ways to protect their units, an Empire unit capable of filching their rivals' resources, and a fearsome new Chaos legend.

Each army seeks the means to conquer its foes. With Portent of Doom, the course of history may be decided by those few individuals tasked to find Artefacts of power and to recover them as weapons to be employed in the heat of battle!
123483.name: Warhammer: Invasion – Portent of Doom

123484.description:
The Object of the game is to achieve an alignment of three pieces of Your color before opponent by making simultaneous displacements.

The pawns are placed on the central board and each player chooses number of movements and destination with his dice on his board. The results are revealed simultaneously.
- If a piece lands on a space occupied, it is placed on top.
- A stack of n pieces can move from 1 to n squares.

A player wins if he makes a row of 3 pawns or if he removes his opponent's pawns

123485.name: Conjudingo
123485.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Conjudingo includes three easy, fun games to help students from Grade 1 to Grade 4 work on the present, future and past tenses of French verbs. The various animals on the cards will help you check if you have found the correct combination.

123486.description:
By playing cards on the table each player tries to connect a maximum of lamas and his gang of lama-girls and form the biggest gang at the end of the game.
Each player has one lama as a secret ally to add all this kind of lamas to his final score.

In his turn player draws a card from the deck or from the discard stack. Then he places one card on the table adjacent to any other card.
Also player may do 1 of the 4 available actions: exchange the card, scream, spit or move.
123486.name: Gangs of Lamas

123487.name: Shabadabada Cinoche
123487.description:
New version of the game Shabadabada but here are more about songs from movies that are played.

Shabadabada Cinoche is a game that caters specifically to cinema lovers who have a solid understanding of classic films.

Two teams compete using predetermined words.

As soon as a player sings part of a song which contains the current word, the other team must find another song containing the word. As soon as a team fails, the other one wins the card.

123488.name: Shabadabada: Edition occitane
123488.description:
Shabadabada promotional version made in Occitan.

Two teams compete using predetermined words.

As soon as a player sings part of a song which contains the current word, the other team must find another song containing the word. As soon as a team fails, the other one wins the card.

123489.description:
Shabadabada 416 is a special limited edition including
Shabadabada, Shabadabada 2 plus some unusual words:
208 in French and 208 words in English = 416 as in name.

Two teams compete using predetermined words.

As soon as a player sings part of a song which contains the current word, the other team must find another song containing the word. As soon as a team fails, the other one wins the card.
123489.name: Shabadabada 416

123490.description:
Add a colored tile each turn, trying to join the largest connected areas to maximize your score. Connect with all three colors for the most points. This game teaches pattern recognition and problem solving. With hundreds of combinations, there are infinite strategies to win!

Each turn, you connect one of your Game Tiles side to side to 1 or more Game Tiles in the middle of the table. The colors of the just-placed tile must match all adjacent tiles. Also, the corners of the Game Tiles must line up completely; that is to say that tiles may not overhang and the corners must match too.

Receive points for each game tile in the color chain that your tile connects to, but not including the tile you are adding.
123490.name: TRIFUSION

123491.name: Si j'étais Président...
123491.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Zahia as sports minister? Igor and Grichka for culture? Karl in the foreign office? Geneviève as home secretary?

Now you are head of state and must form a government made up solely of the right people. Make the right decisions as there are 42 candidates and you have to choose the most competent for each of the six ministries. Your goal is to make your popularity increase faster than that of the other players.

Si J'étais Président... (If I Were President...) is a simple, fun game with six game modes posing various types of challenges: shuffling cabinets, cracking the whip, enduring hung parliaments, etc. Let loose with your choices and the whole country will soon be head over heels in love with you!

123492.name: Astronomie: Lernspiel für Jung und Alt
boardgamefamily: Komet Lernspiele für Jung und Alt
123492.description: This is a small trivia game belonging to the series Wissen-Spielen-Lernen. It contains 98 cards, with questions about the universe. When you answer the questions you can get plus or minus points.

123493.name: Skull & Shackles: Player's Guide
rpgissuearticle: Boarding Ships for Fun and Profit
123493.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Skull & Shackles Player’s Guide gives players all the spoiler-free information, inspiration, and new rules they’ll need to create characters prepared for the swashbuckling adventure and piratical perils of the Skull & Shackles Adventure Path.

Within, players of this campaign will find everything they need to create character backgrounds tied to personalities and events vital to Pathfinder Adventure Path’s expedition onto the high seas, along with new campaign-specific traits to give bold adventurers the edge they’ll need to take on the varied and unpredictable dangers of the pirate isles known as the Shackles. New rules for ship-to-ship combat also give players the resources they'll need to sail pirate vessels, board enemy ships, and claim plunder as true scallywags.

Adventurers don't need to take to the seas unprepared! Gather your allies, practice your best pirate voice, and let the Skull & Shackles Player's Guide set your course for the swashbuckling adventure of the Skull & Shackles Adventure Path.

123494.name: Unravel
123494.description:
Kites are a fun way to spend an afternoon in the park– if only the wind wouldn’t keep tangling up the strings! Race against the other players each round to be the first to figure out who is holding the kite shown on the die roll. This is a great way for kids to practice holding attention and mentally tracing a route in their heads.

First, the players roll the die. This determines the color that is being tracked this turn. At the same time, all players should mentally follow the string from the kite down to figure out which character is holding the other end of the string. Players must not use their fingers, just follow the string's path in their heads.

Once someone thinks they have the right answer, yell "STOP!" and grab the matching Solution Tile. Everyone checks together to see if this is the correct solution. Collect a Pinwheel for a correct answer, but lose a Pinwheel if you're wrong!

If you roll yellow and the yellow balloon is showing near the characters, players have to grab the Yellow Balloon Solution Tile instead of tracing the yellow kite's string. Similarly, if you roll orange and Squawk the parrot is showing near the kites, players have to grab the Squawk Solution Tile instead of tracing the orange kite's string. You lose a Pinwheel if you grab another Solution Tile when you should have chosen Squawk or the balloon!

The game comes with double-sided Character and Kite boards, and 2 double-sided and reversible String Boards to keep players guessing.

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Mental Mapping, Color Recognition, Quick Thinking

123495.description:
The sleeping dragon is protecting her stash of golden eggs, and she won’t be pleased to wake and find there are lizards sharing space in her warm nest. Help the lizards escape without breaking any of her precious eggs. It takes a careful hand to remove the lizards!

The Sleeping Dragon molded piece is placed in the center of the table, with 29 Lizards and 15 Golden Eggs placed on top of it. On your turn, use your Pinchers to try to remove once of the Lizards from the dragon:

- If you are successful without anything falling off the dragon, place the Lizard in front of you. Well done! You also get to keep any other Lizards that are attached!
- If anything falls off the dragon, your turn ends immediately, but you can keep any Lizard already in your Pinchers (and any other Lizards attached to it). Any Lizards that fall off are placed in the box, and any Golden Eggs that fall are placed in front of you!

When all Lizards are removed from the dragon, the game ends. For each Golden Egg in front of you, you must return a Lizard! After accounting for all Golden Eggs, the player with the most Lizards wins.

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Visual Mapping & Analysis, Eye-Hand Coordination, Concentration
123495.name: Dreaming Dragon

123496.name: Hector: Badge of Carnage Episode 2 - Senseless Acts of Justice
123496.description:
User Summary

Hector: Senseless Acts of Justice is the second episode in a trilogy of adventure games developed by Straandlooper and distributed by Telltale games on PC and iOS. The games are extremely lewd, deliberately outrageous, and feature an glib, alcoholic cop as the anti-hero. The characters, humor, and dialog are all markedly British.

123497.name: Roadrunner Park
123497.description:
"A family game for all ages compliments of Roadrunner Pharmacy. Weave your way through Roadrunner Pak to reach the vacation that is waiting to start,"

Six colored pawns representing dogs and cats move around a path on the board using a spinner to determine how many squares to move. Not unlike Candyland - for pets.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Origins Awards Best Board Game Nominee
123499.description:
In City of Iron, 2-4 players compete to build up a small nation in a world of machines, magic, and money. Become the leader of one of four rival nations: the industrious humans, the toad engineers, the scholarly Cresarians, or the clever hogmen. Produce goods like machine parts and bottled demons to gain wealth, or research steam-age technology and recruit mercenaries to control the continent. If you want to establish new cities, you’ll build schooners or airships to reach faraway lands and flying islands. Your cities have limited capacity, so you’ll have to decide what to keep and what to demolish when building advanced structures. The future of a nation is in your hands. Build unbreakable foundations for an empire or disappear into the dusty pages of history.


Build a civilization in a Steampunk setting
Customize two decks of cards in a unique twist on deck-building
Choose your path- build a powerful economy or conquer everything in sight
Includes hundreds of lavishly-illustrated cards, an extra-large board, land boards, coin tokens, and more
123499.name: City of Iron
boardgameexpansion: City of Iron: Clockwork Fortress and Cave Market Promo
City of Iron: Experts and Engines
boardgamepodcastepisode: Champions of Midgard
City of Iron 2nd ed Review with the Game Boy Geek
Cubepushers - Episode 3: To Theme Or Not To Theme
Episode 16:City of Iron/Blue Peg Patrick Hot Seat
Episode 43: The Red Raven Games Episode! (ft. Eight Minute Empire, Dingo's Dreams, City of Iron 2nd Ed.)
Episode 48 - City of Iron 2nd Ed.
Episode 4: Imperial Settlers & Underrated Games
Episode 9: Top 5 Games You Need To Play More Than Once To Appreciate
TDT - Episode # 306 - Hybrid Games
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 38!!! With Ken Grazier and Paul Grogan!!

123500.name: Hunger Games: Girl on Fire
123500.description:
From the creator of the award-winning indie game CANABALT and leading independent film studio Lionsgate comes an all-new action teaser game for the iPhone, iPod Touch and iPad -- THE HUNGER GAMES: GIRL ON FIRE!

After volunteering for the 74th Hunger Games in place of her younger sister, Katniss Everdeen spends the afternoon in the forest outside her home... only to get ambushed by a swarm of Capitol-engineered tracker jackers!

Can you help Katniss make her escape?

Defend Katniss from her attackers with her hunting bow. Leap through treetops with intuitive touch controls. Help Katniss make her way back to District 12!

Source: The Game Website.
